Alas, the potato, a humble thing, doth bear resemblance to that of McDonald's fare. Two meals, cold and uninviting, doth require reheating, and steak, oh skirt steak, doth arrive when all else doth conclude. Freshness, alack, doth flee thy taste, and we, in twilight's hue, doth ponder this poor show. Their excuse, a rush most sudden, doth ring most hollow, and we, in discontent, doth take our leave."

"We took our kid here for her birthday brunch after hearing good things. Called 'em up at 11:30 on a Sunday, and they said they could fit us in at 12:30. Husband asked if they could do something special for the birthday girl, and the guy said sure thing. We got sat down right away when we showed up. Menu was limited, and the food was just okay for the price. We ordered the grilled chicken from the kiddie menu, which was like 15 bucks. Figure you'll drop 25-30 per person. Server forgot the brownie they promised, so I had to remind 'em. They still charged us for it, and that didn't feel too special. Been to plenty of places where birthday desserts are free, but whatever. Won't be back."

"Drinks, unique and delish, but pricey as hell. Food? Forgettable. Atmosphere, nice, but that's what the high ratings are for, I reckon. Had a few dishes, including the duck salad, but none worth repeating. Good drinks, good service, but food? Meh."

"Fie upon the entree, a spicy pasta dish it was,
That did not impress, but rather did displease.
For though the drinks were sweet and appetizers fine,
The main course did not live up to its billing, I do confess.
And so, I took most of it home, but alas,
It met its end within the dustbin's grasp."
"Four of us had a damn good entree, but the hot chocolate lava cake was a letdown. Thought it came with the meal, but they charged extra. Want a dessert latte? Go to Mickey D's."

"Been here thrice, ambivalent feelings. Last two visits, staff seemed indifferent to providing decent service. First time, they knocked it outta the park. Veggie sandwich for the missus, best she's had. My burger, delish. Service, top-notch. Second time, meals were mediocre. Service, fair. Had their cobbler, not bad, but no mom's cobbler. Third time, meals sub-par, service, near nonexistent."
"Food, good. Service, bad. Woman at bar, loud. Place, clean."

"Learning curve's a bitch. Car wash raids turned staff into aggressive upsellers. Greeted with a hard sell, felt like a hostage. Undone work at the end of the line, rag soaked in Armourall cleaned passenger side. Complained, girl walked to gas station, returned with Funyuns. Didn't help, still stuck. Ran it through the wash again. Waited an hour, ridiculous. Manager shrugged it off. Done with the carousel."

"Went to the joint in Green Valley. Quatro Fromagi, they call it. Crust was mushy, needed a knife and fork to eat the damn thing. Motley Crue playing in the background, didn't quite fit. Dark, dingy decor, like something out of a bad dream. Wood tables, not enough sealant, last customer's leftovers still stuck to 'em. Involtini wasn't half bad, though. Not worth going back for, though."
"Blu Basil, airport eatery, pricey. Should be cheap, not expensive."

"Decent BBQ, but pricey. Huge portions, though. Food's closer to 3 stars, but service was subpar. Guy behind the counter, African American, was friendly to everyone else, but not me. Not usually one to notice, but it was obvious. He gave out samples and chatted with others, but barely acknowledged me. Don't know if it was race or my smile, but it was upsetting. Place has its perks - free ice cream, kids love the ham. Will return, hoping for better service next time."
"Seafood here? Least fresh in Phoenix. Better sushi at Safeway or Trader Joes. Beer and wine menu? Unremarkable. Far West side? Try Koi, across from Arrowhead Harkins."

"First day for SkySong farmers market. Not too bad. Small selection of fresh produce. Mostly pricey cheese, jelly, lotions. Great location though. Unique design. I'll give 'em another shot. Hope they step it up."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

I ordered a burger and onion rings. The burger was frozen, nothing special. The onion rings were good, but that's it. Not worth the same price as Hillstone's burger. The place was dirty, catering to the late-night crowd who didn't seem to mind the grime. That's my takeaway.
"Korean karaoke, I expected. Chinese knockoff, I got. No search, no real soundtracks. We sang loud, tried to find songs. Location and service, meh. Four stars, minus the KTV issues."

"Place is a dump. Didn't wanna step foot in. Gonna try and sell my wares, but one look inside and I knew forget it. Purses and clothes, beat up and way overpriced. Fakes too. Jewelry and hair clips, dirt cheap but not worth it. Only thing worth mentioning, the gauges. Not going back."

"Terrible service. Food was just okay. Long waits. Asked for wings before our meal, but they still brought 'em out cold. Twenty-five minutes for the appetizer, two and a half for the main course. What's the point of French toast?"

"Forty-six bucks on Expedia. Good location for our Glendale trip. Friendly staff. Free hot breakfast. Room was decent. Hallways, elevator, carpet, lobby furniture? Dirty, not just dated. Patio looked nice, but the tables and chairs hadn't been cleaned in weeks. Three staff members stood off to the side, chatting while only three people ate breakfast. Bothered me."
"Sat down for lunch, waited for service. Ordered smoked meat spaghetti, decent but overpriced. Won't be back alone."

Ranger Mike Garcia, grumpy bugger that he was, set a shitty tone for our visit. Sorry to have bothered him, but we were just trying to enjoy the damn park. He soured the whole experience right from the get-go. The movie was meh, the ruins were meh, but for crying out loud, put someone with a pulse at the front desk.

"We came here with friends, though we're locals. Service was poor, our waitress was rude and unattentive. Frozen daiquiris were decent, fried mac and cheese was great. My burger, though, was a disappointment. Ordered a cheeseburger with everything, came with bacon I hadn't asked for and no fries. It was cold, undercooked, and the cheese was scarce. Not worth returning for."

"Sammy's Airport Bar & Grill: overpriced, subpar grub, but we still go there. Why? The Waborita, man. It's not bad. Get it at the bar, though. Service is slow. They do some charity work, so it's not a total waste. If you're early for your flight, grab a Waborita. It's pricey, but it's a decent drink."

"Carnevino, another Vegas steakhouse. Heard good things, being at Palazzo. Batali's joint, gotta be solid, right? Not quite. 

Hostess, stunning. Worth another visit. 

Ravioli, handmade, duck sauce, great dish. Not heavy, full of flavor. 

Bone-in ribeye for two, medium, twitching. Cut and served, bloody. Don't know if my taste buds are refined enough. Cooked, key word. Steak, not so much. 

Pricey, unsatisfying dinner. 

Good wine selection, though."

"Wings, folks rave 'bout 'em. But not the customer, no sir. We get a local deal, $5 food credit in the mail. So we get 'em now and then. But let me tell ya, they're dry, not so tasty. Best to put sauce on the side. They take their sweet time, 10-15 mins to take your order, another 20-30 to get 'em to go. Think they want you to spend cash on their tight slots while you wait? That's the ticket."

"Stayed here 'cause I had Hilton honors points. Customer service, good. Hotel, not so much. Said it was renovated, but bathroom was a mess. Ceramic peeling, water pressure weak. Faucet leaked, annoying as hell. Dust everywhere. Guy at check-in said I was upgraded to a strip view. Yeah, real nice view of MGM. Wonder what the regular rooms looked like. Small chair, stained. Bed, comfy enough. Overall, place looked like an old Vegas dump."

"Went to the SpaFitFinder launch party with SpacePhoenix. Place was packed, but the TrimTini was top-notch. Guy from Urban 7 was real friendly, kept bringing out good eats. Not my kind of joint, but it was a fun night."

"Been here a few times, year past. Disappointed, mostly. Staff ain't rude, just not too helpful. Ulta's always missing something. Hair products, buy two get one free. Always. Selection's limited compared to Best of the West."

"A hearty, consistent feast we did enjoy,  
As is our custom when we doth come to Denny's.  
'Tis a fine place to gather with thy kin,  
And for a fair price, a good meal thou shalt win.  
But alas, a star I must remove,  
For slow service, caused by lack of folk to serve.  
Thus, four stars doth Denny's earn from me,  
Despite the fact that we didst enjoy our tea."

"Steak was decent, but overpriced at forty bucks a plate. Ordered the surf 'n turf special with scallops and two five-ounce filets. Filets were cooked right, nice cuts of meat, but nothing to write home about. Scallops were a letdown, didn't meet my expectations for a joint like this."

"Hark! What news is this? KFC doth change its ways,
And I, in sooth, do fear 'tis not for better days.
Their chicken, once a savory delight,
Now doth assault mine taste with salt's fierce might.

But wait! Their sides, they do redeem the meal,
Mashed potatoes, coleslaw, mac n cheese, a hearty steal.
And biscuits, too, they doth provide a treat,
A respite from the saltiness that doth greet.

Yet, verily, I say, this place doth not deserve
My custom, save for those few dishes that serve.
Forsooth, a habit 'twill not become, I swear,
For KFC's changes doth leave much to fear."

"Wings at Hooters, that's what the ladies go for, unless they're trying to prove something. And let me tell you, I've been pretty good about keeping my mouth shut on this topic, but the QC has been a pleasant surprise overall. But let's be real, every Hooters in Chicagoland has better wings than this one. Heck, even the Hooters in Puerto Vallarta had better wings. These were just mediocre, not as flavorful, and the batter wasn't as flaky. I mean, come on, if I'm gonna eat at a chain, I expect the wings to taste like Hooters wings! Standardization, folks! Bah, well at least the server was nice. Shaun, I think that was her name, she was sweet."

"Hark, my dearest wife and I, for many moons,
Have graced House of Blues with our noble presence,
To partake in feast and revel in sweet tunes,
But alas, last eve, our joy did swiftly wane.

A pox upon the hostess, who didst place us
Far from the stage, in a most distant corner,
And when we asked to move, her reply didst sting,
"No server here, thy wish doth not avail."

And lo, the menu didst reveal its woe,
With prices high and choices few,
Mashed potatoes cold, and snap peas the same,
For $3.99, a price most unjust and lame.

The rest of the menu, once full of delight,
Now doth resemble a barren winter's night,
Devoid of charm and sustenance both,
Leaving us to ponder, in dismay and wroth.

Yet, fair fortune didst smile upon us,
When a floor manager, with apologies, didst fuss,
And moved us to a better seat, with grace,
And gifted us with drinks and dessert, in her place.

Our servers, too, didst earn our praise,
With their attentive care and pleasant ways,
But still, the night's mood, didst sour begin,
With that first faux pas, which didst cast a sin.

So, House of Blues, take heed of this tale,
And mend thy ways, lest thou dost fail."

"Uncomfortable seats, broken and dirty. Went to see Met Opera performance. Sound from next door's theater seeped in. Stale popcorn, fake butter with no flavor. Had to add it myself, soggy top, flavorless bottom. No flavored salt like Harkin's. Great program, shitty venue."

"Food was subpar. Fifty bucks for one person. Panda Express serves better grub. Orange peel chicken? Cold and flavorless. Veggies? Dirty and unappetizing. Atmosphere saved it from a single-star rating."

"Subpar experience with too much repetition."

Biscuits, bisquick. Gravy, no sausage. Chicken fried steak, breaded hamburger. Apple Danish, good.

"Five Guys, a place of feed, doth serve a burger fair,
And fries, with flavor, that doth please the taste.
But, alas, their service, doth leave much to desire,
For twice, now, have I waited, with naught to acquire.

In yonder mall, a fast food joint, they be,
Yet, slow, their service, doth seem to me.
Twenty minutes, didst we wait, the first time,
And yet, again, last eve, the same didst climb.

The staff, rude, didst answer, when we didst ask,
About our food, so long, in coming, didst task.
Late, we were, for the movie, and in disarray,
I shall not hasten, to Five Guys, again, this day.

If time, I have, a sit down meal, I shall seek,
For fast food, no more, my patience, doth break.
Fix, their service, must, or lose, they shall,
Customers, like me, who crave, a quicker call."

"Upscale joint, but the grub didn't impress. Menu was lackin', service was meh. Ambiance was nice, but that don't make up for the mediocre caesar salad. Pricey too. Aria mall, though, that's a different story. Pristine and upscale, just how it should be."

"Thirty-five bucks a head? For real? Mac and cheese station, cool concept, but execution fell short. Runny mess. Desserts lacked depth, selection limited. Salads, not bad. Marscapeone polenta, nice touch. Shrimp cocktail, nonexistent. Crab legs, lukewarm. Nice dining space, servers on point. But for the price, not worth it. Asian section, three items. Sushi selection, pathetic. No ahi, sashimi, or nigiri. Rolls looked like gas station fare."

"Strip Steak at Mandalay Bay left much to be desired. Long wait for mediocre grub. Chop was flavorless, filets were just okay. Duck fat fries and truffle mac were decent, asparagus was good, mushrooms were cold. Poor selection of desserts, but cheesecake was light and tasty. Overall, a disappointing meal for $400. Skip it."

"Flame Broiler, love it. But this one, tough to enjoy. Food wasn't up to par. Music, too loud, couldn't hear the woman taking my order. Said it was loud, she just smiled. Maybe she couldn't hear me? Might go back, but won't eat in."

"Methinks the service was swift and good,
Aye, ordered was a Octoberfest burger, and my guest, a cheeseburger, as well.
The fries, they did abound, in quantity, 'twas a feast,
No need to ask for more, our hunger to appease.
Alas, the burgers, they didst not impress,
Both of us didst think them similar to meatloaf, or filled with some other mess.
Ten dollars, a fair price, I do confess,
But for this burger, methinks 'twas not worth the cost, alack!"

"Hark, our merry band didst decide to dine
Upon this establishment, forsooth, on a Sunday morn.
The prices, ranging from seven ninety-five to ten ninety-five,
Didst seem most reasonable, and so we didst adjourn.

Some of us didst order eggs benedict, which dish didst please,
Whilst others didst opt for turkey, with mashed potatoes and stuffing,
But alas, the latter didst taste of boxed mix, and the seasoning
Didst lean towards saltiness, which didst leave us all quite vexed.

One member of our party didst request eggs, fruit, and croissant,
A simple meal, yet satisfying, and so no complaint didst ensue.
But, alack, the service didst leave much to be desired,
For the host didst not greet us, nor didst he show any fire.
No bon jour, no welcome, nay, not even a smile,
Didst our waiter bestow upon us, and so we didst beguile.
He seemed annoyed, and his demeanor didst bespeak
A man who didst loathe his work, and didst not wish to speak.

This company must relearn the art of hospitality,
For such behavior doth not beseem a place of dignity.
We wouldst have fared better at Denny's or Village Inn,
Wherefore, I give this place but two stars, and that's being kind."

"Birthday dinner at this joint? Forget it. They botched almost everything. Friend's salad came with croutons, despite her gluten-free request. Sister's burger? Burnt to a crisp. Grandma's sandwich? Jalapenos galore, despite her order being sans spice. Beer's decent, but that's where the positives end. Patio smoking allowed? No thanks. Smell wafts in, ruining the experience. Four Peaks is the better bet."

"Good spot for a cold one and some R&R. Plan on hangin' for a bit. Took a seat and waited 15-20 min for a server to take our order. Food took 30 min, and another 20 min for the check. Might come back if I've got time to kill. Otherwise, I'll look for a joint that's a little more on top of their game."
"Lasagna, overcooked and swimming in cheese. Pizza, too much of the same. Service, apathetic. Atmosphere, tacky and forgettable. No reason to return."

My love and I did dine at this place last week,
I ordered ahi sliders, a tasteful treat,
And an "I love bacon" burger, oh how grand!
But alas, the meal did not meet our demand.

The slider buns, they did not complement
The flavor of the fish and ponzu sauce, I do lament.
And the burger, oh dear, it had no sauce,
I could not finish it, nor did my love, of course.

He had the jalapeno burger, but did not eat,
For the taste, it did not meet his sweet.
I may give it another chance, who knows?
Perhaps they had a bad day, the cooks, I suppose.
"Slow service, ignored by staff. Been here before, didn't impress. Friends wanted to try it, nice atmosphere though."

"Liked the homemade chips, mmm. Red salsa, good too. Chicken in enchiladas, tender. Service, good. Didn't like the green sauce, bland. Beans and rice, disappointing. Maybe it's my fault, unfamiliar with New Mexican food."
"Gado gado sauce, good. Chicken, fried too much. Mixed veggie sauce, too thick, too salty, MSG likely."

"Terrible service. Worst I've had here. Food's overpriced and the seasoning on the cheese curds was off. Too strong. Place has a lot of TVs with sports, but they're right next to the sports book with the same TVs. Shame."

"Thai Pan replacement in N. Scottsdale? Disappointment. Owners, scrap the sushi bar idea. Focus on Thai flavors and textures. Heat doesn't come from just red chili peppers. Canned vs. fresh pineapple, people can tell. Peanut sauce, tasty. Red curry, OK after doctoring with hot sauces. Other dishes, mediocre. Reviewer who said it's authentic Thai food? Get your tongue checked, buddy. Sticking with Swaddee and Sala Thai for our Thai fix."

"Meh. Been better. Yelp stole my thunder. Anyways, I rolled into this joint looking for some legit Taiwanese breakfast. Chinatown, right? Should be easy peasy. Saw 'YongHe', thought I hit the jackpot. Inside, not so much. They tried, I'll give 'em that. But, c'mon, beef wrap/roll and Chinese donuts? That's like calling a hot dog a hamburger. Lazy. Soymilk and fantuan were meh. Service? Forget about it. Waited forever, staff seemed overwhelmed. Maybe dinner's better, but I ain't holding my breath."
"Run-down joint. Not worth the trip. Employees ain't no help neither. Save yourself the trouble, drive a bit further for a decent Walmart."

"Took the missus here for a fancy meal, on account of the good reviews. But let me tell you, it was a real disappointment. Sat us down quick, but the grub was a real letdown. Fettuccine alfredo, no flavor to speak of. No garlic, no nothing. Waitress was nice, but when we told her the food was bland, she didn't seem too surprised. Brought us some free dessert, but that was a bust too. I gotta say, Olive Garden's got more flavor. And we ain't exactly fans of that place neither. My advice? Skip this joint, grab some groceries, cook up your own meal at home. You'll save money and eat better too."

"Upon the waters of Madison, we didst set sail,
And here, upon the deck, didst take our meal.
The sun didst shine bright, and all didst seem well,
But when the victuals came, our joy didst dwindle.

I didst order forth the shrimp po boy,
Whilst two companions didst choose tuna steak,
And one, the chicken panini, didst enjoy.
But when we didst taste, our faces didst turn sour,
For all the dishes were not quite up to par.

The chicken, tough and chewy, didst offend,
The tuna, overcooked, didst lose its charm,
And my sweet potato fries, with batter thick,
Didst lack the crispiness that doth make them grand.

Alas, what hath become of genuine fries?
Are they now naught but frozen, bagged affairs?
I do detest such additions, brought to please,
For they do naught but mar the natural flavors.

So, next we sail the lakes of Madison fair,
We shall eschew Bourbon Street Grille, and seek
The Green Lantern, where true culinary delights await."
"Good grub, pricey. Atmosphere's top-notch, but the comida's a bit too tame for my taste. Worth a visit, but don't expect a fiesta in your mouth."

"Brunch at Bellagio or Wynn? Wynn won out, thanks to raves about its swank atmosphere. But the grub? Meh. Cold apps, parched fish, burnt prime rib, watery crab legs. Shrimp saved the day, but not worth the $50 per head, tax and tip included."

"Back for round two, we were. Food, not bad, but not great either. Stand by my word, I do. Salt and pepper, added I did, to the steak. Fat, that's what the prime rib was, mostly. Steaks, I cook, at home. Marbling, I know. Balance, there must be. Outback Steakhouse, better taste, lower price. Chandler Blvd, never disappointed. Firebirds, not for us, sorry."

"Drove to Union County for fried chicken and onion rings.  No onion rings on the menu anymore.  What's the reason?  They were damn good.  Chicken cooked in rancid oil.  Been going there for years, but this won't keep me coming back."
"Lunch buffet at this joint? Forget it. Place felt grimy, service was slow. Food? Don't even get me started. Dry, oily, terrible. Better options out there. Skip it."
"Chow Mein's good, rest is meh. Skimpy on meat too. Guy behind counter's got a smart mouth. Not worth the trip."

"Holly's got nothing going for her, talent-wise. She's got a nice bod, sure, but that's where it ends. The rest of the cast did their best, but they'd have been better off without her. I got a few laughs out of it, but mostly I was fighting to stay awake. There's gotta be better shows in Vegas for your buck."

Tao was alright. Friend said she tried three times, finally got in. They herded us around, door guy was cool, explained layout, stamped my wrist. We walked around, food looked good, decor was nice, enough bars. But everyone and their aunt Susy was there, pushing and shoving, no excuse me. Mood killer. Went to Tao beach, small, pools at MGM bigger. No room to sit or dance, line to wait in to go downstairs. Same songs played on different levels. Had the experience but worse than Hollywood club, no bacon-wrapped dogs outside. What the hell?

"A seafood joint like this, stuck in the middle of nowhere, and it's still breathin'? That's a mystery to me. But I reckon it's got something to do with that Sancerre '10. If they'd served it right, maybe it would've been the saving grace. But they didn't, so it ain't."

"Methinks 'twas a strange and wondrous night,
Forsooth, we ventured forth to dine,
By virtue of a gift most fair and bright,
Which didst compel us to partake in this rite.

But lo, the server, quaint and queer,
Didst ply us with a tale most drear,
Of tables crammed in corners, flies that didst swarm,
And viands strange, that didst disarm.

Alack, we were not taken by the charm,
Of this odd place, with menu most bizarre,
And so, we vow, to nevermore return,
To this strange tavern, with its eerie atmosphere."

"Samba at The Mirage? Major letdown. Should've known from the reviews. Go elsewhere for a real Brazilian steakhouse experience. They tried to fill us up with mediocre chicken, dry sausage, and garlic bread. Then, two bite-sized pieces of beef. I thought, 'Okay, more later.' But no, that was it. When I asked for more, they brought a bit more. Plantains, rice, and beans were decent. Dessert? Awful. Tasted like it had been sitting in the fridge for days."

"Methinks my love and I didst dine upon this establishment's fare this eve. Our memories of yore didst recall a certain je ne sais quoi, a certain savoir faire, if thou wilt, that didst impel us to return once more unto this culinary domicile. 

Alas, the bruschetta, a humble dish indeed, didst fail to impress. 'Twas naught but a pale imitation of former feasts, a mere shadow of its former self. My love, in his infinite wisdom, didst choose the blackened chicken pasta, a dish that didst stir within me memories of days of yore, of a certain chef boyardie that didst grace our table in times past. 

And I, in turn, didst select the four cheese pizza, a dish that didst leave much to be desired, I do confess. The sauce, a paltry excuse for a condiment, didst lack the verve and zest of former feasts, while the cheese, alack, didst possess a certain...plasticity, if thou wilt, that didst leave a most unpleasant taste upon mine lips. 

In conclusion, methinks this establishment doth leave much to be desired. Alack, my love, mayhap another time shall we find a venue more worthy of our refined tastes."

"Upon mine friends and me, this eating house did call,
For in the village, 'twas the merriest of them all.
A minstrel played inside, his tunes did reach our ears,
And thus, a tranquil night did our company prepare.

I did request a burrito, carne asada being mine choice,
With beans and rice, a generous helping, did they bring.
Alas, the meat did seem like ground beef, and its flavor, quite plain,
But my dear boy, his chimichanga, did find some grace.

Around the board, a consensus did arise,
That though the victuals were not wondrous, neither were they vile.
Of six dishes, chicken fajitas, the best did prove,
Yet, alack, the margaritas, watered down, did not remove
Our cares, nor did the other potions, strong they were not,
Save straight shots, perchance, then a good time might be got.

Our server, Omar, kind and courteous, five stars did earn,
But, alas, the total experience, not so much did learn.
In future, this place, I shall eschew, and seek another,
Or peradventure, stop for tequila, but no more, another."

"Pittsburgh, thy pizza doth suffer from a curse,
A plague of undercooking, a fate most dire.
The crust, it doth lack crispness, and the cheese,
Doth fail to turn golden, a sorry sight indeed.

The sauce, a generic brew, doth taste of naught,
A cheap concoction from a jar, no more.
The price, a fair two dollars, doth ease the sting,
But alas, the pizza itself, doth leave much to desire.

Doughy and rubbery, a bland and sorry sight,
It doth seem that Pittsburgh's pizza doth not excite.
The workers, friendly they may be, but alas,
Their pizza, a disappointment, doth leave much to pass."

"A fair tavern, with servants most kind,
But, alas! their wines do leave much to find.
Their list, though scant, doth boast some rare vintages,
Yet, I suspect, 'tis but a ploy to raise the prices.
I asked the staff, who didst reply,
That their masters sought to stock wines most rare,
And thus, the prices, they didst justify.
A glass of wine, ten dollars, I didst pay,
For a bottle, eleven, they didst sell, by day.
'Twas passable, yet, I must confess,
I expected more, for such a sum, I must profess."

Sitting outside, sipping drinks, and watching people pass by was the highlight of my evening. My husband and I dropped by for dessert and drinks, but the price didn't match the quality. Sixteen bucks for a martini? Not worth it. They were good, but not that good. I expected more from the Sugar Factory, especially with their name. The fruit tart was a letdown. I could've made a better one at home. The crust was too thick and soggy. My husband's chocolate cake was rich, too rich. It was pretty, but the flavor was overpowering. I won't be back, and I wouldn't recommend it to my friends.
"City Art Centre's part, not great. Overpriced breakfast, skip it. Better deals elsewhere."

"Alas, my heart doth yearn for fish tacos grand,
But here, alack, they failed to please my land.
Their victuals were but average, I do swear,
And margaritas, merely passable, I fear.
Their components, cheap and lacking in flair,
Didst leave me in dismay, with naught to spare.
Perhaps their renown doth stem from being sole,
In NoDa, a Mexican eatery, I do role.
But nay, their grub doth not deserve such praise,
For blackened mahi mahi tacos brought me gaze.
'Tis but a mediocre feast, I must confess,
And those who seek the best, should look elsewhere, alas."

"Beware, fair shoppers, for all sales here are final,
No returns or store credits for brand new items, I do declare.
A pity, indeed, for this store doth have a fine selection,
And the salesfolk, they are most courteous and kind.
But alas, no refunds or exchanges, so choose wisely,
Lest thou be stuck with a purchase that doth not suit thee."

"Fish tacos, damn good. But this place, changed. Not for the better. Twenty years, and it shows. KFC/Chandler city battle, took its toll. Politics, winning and losing. Decor, same as it was. Tables, chairs, horrific. BBQ guy, outside, confusing. Smells, didn't mix. Memories, better than reality. No mas."

"I hit the books hard. Finding decent study spots in Glendale ain't easy. Paradise is the best of the bunch near school. They got plenty of outlets, wifi that works sometimes, and passable joe. Plus, they give out free snacks when you're in the hole for a quarter mil. Not bad, right?

Thing is, nothing here's worth the price. Coffee's either too dark or flavored funny. I take my coffee serious, so that's a no-go. Food's way overpriced too. Supposed to be a bakery, but the bread's bland and the cookies taste like cardboard. 

I'll still go there for a change of scenery, but wouldn't recommend it for much else."

"Food was good, griller was nice, but green. Waitress was friendly, but slow with refills and forgot my husband's card. She also dropped a fork in the sauce and splattered it all over him. Kids enjoyed their meals, but we all got sick afterwards. Bathrooms were disgusting, worst than a port-a-potty. Second time there, first time was decent, but this experience has ruined it for us. Won't be going back."

"Underwhelming experience at too crowded a pool with too much repetition in amenities and not enough shade."

"Skip it, kid. This place ain't worth your time. Too many people, not enough space. They got one bar, and it takes forever to get a drink. And don't even get me started on the prices. Lockers for 40 bucks a day? Waters for 10? Forget about it. If you want a good time, go somewhere else. The crowd's alright, but the venue itself is lacking. Stick to Encore Beach, Wet Republic, or Marquee. They know how to do it right."

"Jimmy Buffett, I love the guy. But his Margaritaville Cafe? Not so much. Food's alright, I guess. But not worth the wait or the price. 

Pros: It serves food, I'll give it that. Decorations are fun, especially downstairs and upstairs. Connects to the store that sells all sorts of Margaritaville crap. 

Cons: Lines are ridiculous. Food's overpriced and not that great. Margaritas? Processed, man. Not worth it. 

Wouldn't go again, but friends always want to give it a shot."

"Methinks 'twas a Wednesday afternoon when first I stepped within this bakery's doors. The folk who worked there seemed most cordial, and their wares didst tempt mine eyes. Macarons, I had heard tell of them, but ne'er had tasted. Alack! I knew not what to expect, thinking them perchance a cake, with frosting 'twixt two halves. Thus, I chose five varieties to sample: peach, vanilla almond, vanilla, raspberry, and the blue one (alas, its name escapes me now). But lo! When I didst bite into them, they were o'er sweet for mine taste, akin to cookies in texture, yet lacking that certain je ne sais quoi. Mayhap others shall find joy in them, but alas, they didst not agree with mine own palate. Still, I shall return anon, to try other delights this bakery doth offer."
"I read the raves, decided to check it out. Underwhelming experience. Not as great as the hype."

"Walmart. Rarely go. Mess. Carts everywhere. Disorganized sections. Like a bad bargain basement sale. No one cares. Can't find products. Trash. Competition comes to town. Don't compete. Make store look like trash instead. Really?

Walk to cash. Light on. Cashier missing. Stand there. Decide if we pay. Manager notices. Calls girl back. Four cashiers. One walks away. People wait. 

Handicapped parking limited. Impossible to find spot. They don't care. Shameful."

"Upon the strip, I chanced upon this place,
With outdoor seats, a wondrous sight,
A popular spot, it seemed, from NY's grace,
And thus, my curiosity took flight.

We tried to sit, but had to roam,
Through tables, back and forth, to reach our home,
A strange affair, yet we did abide,
For our server, kind and helpful, did reside.

I ordered burgers, unsure of my choice,
Thinking it hard to make a mistake,
But lo, the meat was tough and dry,
A disappointment, nigh a lie.

My love, a double burger did desire,
Yet came without a bun, a burning fire,
So we paid more, for him to partake,
And thus, my burger, left untouched, did make.

Room for dessert, a sweet delight,
Deep-fried Oreo sundae, a wondrous sight,
Creative and rich, a decadent treat,
We shared it, but could not finish neat.

To that location, I may not return,
Or perhaps, to NYC, my heart will yearn,
Just for the sweets, my soul doth crave,
And thus, my tale, of this place, I do engrave."
"Garcia's pizza joint? Forget it. Cute from the outside, sure. But don't be fooled. The pizza's nothing special. Skip it."

"Burger craving hit, Yelp open. Read reviews, sold. Mapquested, on the road. Hole in the wall, who cares? Double with chili and cheese, please. Driving home, excitement builds. First bite, disappointment. Chili bland, can't taste it. Second bite, same story. Burger good, like In-N-Out. Chili, no thanks. Salt added, still bad. Fries meh, refried maybe? In-N-Out better. Chili, nope. Cheeseburger, yes. Back to eating, reluctantly."

"Sweet Tomatoes? More like Sour Disappointment. Packed with soccer moms and their rugrats, this joint's got nothing on me. Salad bar's alright, but overpriced and skimpy on the good stuff. Name's a lie, too - no sweet cherry tomatoes in sight. What's the point?

They try to sell it as healthy, but it's just carb city. Pasta, bread, mac and cheese, soup - not exactly what I'd call a healthy option. Where's the protein? Leave me hungry, it does.

Overpriced and low-quality, this place ain't worth it. You can do better, kid."
"Ruben's a mess, too much repetition. Poutine's got more fries than curds and gravy. No decent beer on the menu. \n\nVeggie options? Pasta, pizza, or a salad without meat."

"Rented from Payless Car Rental, regretted it. Agent was polite, efficient, but pushed insurance and gas fill-ups. Refused 'em, got hit with a $20 mandatory roadside assist surcharge. BS. Could've gotten a better ride from Dollar or Alamo. Won't be back. Try E-Z Car Rental instead."

"Bougainville's fare did not impress, I fear.
Our drinks arrived swiftly, but then, alas!
The food, it did take its sweet time to appear.
Forty-five minutes passed, and still no cheer.
The eggs, they were runny, a sorry sight.
But sourdough toast and hashbrowns, they were bright.
The bacon, strange, and pink, his burger did stay.
Despite being ordered medium, 'twas a foul play.
We tried our luck at the wheel of fortune's spin.
I lost five dollars, but gained sixty-five within.
A Miller Lite and vodka tonic, our winnings did bring.
Our early morning meal, they did cover, with a swing.
Two hours later, a waste receptacle, I did adore.
The eggs, they were the cause, I do implore.
The service, good, our server, skilled and kind.
A shame, the food did not meet the mark, I find."

"Lee's Vietnamese sandwiches didn't impress. Maybe it's 'cause the last time I had one, it was done right. When I walked in, I thought it was an American sub shop. They had a small section of Vietnamese products, but it didn't feel authentic. 

I got the grilled pork sandwich, thit nuong. Same as the one I had before, but that one was in Sacramento. This one missed the mark. The pork lacked flavor, the portion was small, and the sauce wasn't my cup of tea. The bread was good, though. Crispy outside, soft inside. 

My dad got the combo sandwich. Don't know what kind of meat was in it, but he didn't like it either. If you're lookin' for a real Vietnamese sandwich, keep lookin'. I was disappointed."

"Place didn't impress me. Loved Fate, great chef. Eat out daily, lunch or dinner. Service was poor, server had an attitude. Whole table felt it. Tapas, sure, but $100 food check without drinks? Too much. Leave hungry? No way. Won't be back."
"Herbox, been there a few times. Last visit, menu was off. Not the same. Missing the familiar faces, the friendly staff. Used to be a fave spot in Scottsdale, now? Not so much."

"Methought the fellow who took my order didst besmirch me with his haughty tone, as if my choices were beneath him. And lo, the signs they didst write, in haste and with little care, didst make excuses for their slow service and their privy, reserved for patrons alone. A pox upon their house, say I! For all their faults, the decor didst please mine eyes, like unto a noodle stand in the orient. Their Cambod-Ican broth didst taste of pho, yet not o'erwhelming, and my companion's crispy noodles didst seem like sweet, poor China takeout. Her curry, spicy and fiery, didst not sit well with her stomach. The payment system, clumsy and slow, didst vex me sore. Why not take payment straightaway, at the window, ere I must don my cloak anew, to signal them to bring the bill? 'Tis a puzzlement, indeed."
"Food was good. Soda machine had plenty of flavors."

"Enchiladas at La Parilla Suiza? More like a sad, soggy mess. My girl's translation of the name? Spot on. Chicken enchiladas with green sauce, recommended by the server. Expecting gooey cheese and meat, got a dab of chicken and a twangy sauce instead. Not exactly what I had in mind. Service? Non-existent. Our server disappeared after delivering the food, leaving us with a filthy carafe of water that looked like it belonged in a Star Trek episode. All in all, not impressed."

"Four of us dined at thy establishment,
With filets of beef, 9 oz., our desire.
Medium rare, we asked, yet they arrived,
O'ercooked, alas! and nigh unto despair.

I straightaway told the waiter, who agreed,
To take them back, and swiftly he did proceed.
The cook, through yonder window, didst ask,
"Do they wish more cooking?" Oh, what a task!

The steaks, indeed, were cooked too long,
And though the light may have played a part, 'twas wrong.
The waiter ne'er did speak another word,
Nor offered any solace to our discomfort, oh so absurd.

As one who once did reside in Wisconsin's land,
I know full well how supper clubs should stand.
But alas, thy business doth not meet the mark,
And thus, my recommendation, I must embark.

Sorry, good sirs, for this poor review,
But truth must be told, as all men should do."
"Macaroni Grill. Been there, done that. Not much to rave about. Service? Forgettable. Prices, reasonable."
"Wings were mediocre, too much repetition."

"This joint was just okay. Food was meh, atmosphere wasn't doing it for me. Servers seemed like they couldn't care less. Had the lunch buffet, which was decent. Naan was the highlight, though. Fresh and unlimited."

"Urgent Care, huh? Sounds like they'll take care of you quick and proper, like a doctor but faster. But no, not quite. First off, you gotta wait even when the place is empty. And second, all they got is nurse practitioners, which ain't bad, but they can't prescribe the good stuff, ya know? So you end up getting less treatment than you would from your regular doc and you gotta wait forever for it. Makes you wonder why bother with Urgent Care at all."

"Hark! My spouse and I, first-time visitors, do declare
This Taiwanese fare doth not please mine taste, I fear.
The prices, too, do seem a mite steep,
For quality of victuals, not quite up to keep."

"First-time try at this joint. Prices, reasonable. Grub, subpar. Over easy, came out medium-hard. Not pleased. Pancakes, taste like crusty rags. Ugh. Bacon, hashbrowns, decent. Service, meh. Won't return. Too many better breakfast spots in the area. Peoria Cafe or Brothers, recommend."

"On Saturday, we chanced upon this eatery,
Around one and thirty, as the day drew near its end.
The queue, alas, did stretch and wind,
A lengthy wait, our patience did test and try.

We paid, in total, forty-one gold coins,
For each, a sum of thirty-seven, tax included within.
Our number, nine, they seated round,
In twain, a table, fit for royalty, profound.

The victuals, though, did not impress,
Their look, a feast, but taste, alas, did not transpire.
Exotic dishes, duck ravioli, tea eggs,
Yet portioned small, in pans, their serving size did beg.

The beef brisket, mashed potatoes, divine,
The black forest cheesecake, sweetness intertwined.
But lo, the lights, they dimmed, the food, away,
At three o'clock, no warning given, our dismay."

"A gel polish change didst I receive, for both mine hands and feet,
And verily, I must confess, great disappointment didst it bring.
$40, a steep price to pay, for naught but a gel polish change,
No pedicure, alas, to make mine feet look fair and bright.

She cut mine nails too short, and now they resemble french tipped nubs,
Ugly and unsightly, a sorry state, indeed.
I had thought to get acrylics, but the cost didst give me pause,
So gel manicure, I settled for, though naught but mediocre, it was.

The Yelp discount, I didst mention, and $12 off, they didst take,
But still, the price, didst seem quite steep, for what didst they make.
No tip, didst I give, for service poor, didst she provide,
But still, a token, I didst leave, in courtesy, I didst presume.

Nevermore, shall I return, to this place, I do declare,
For service bad, and prices high, didst leave me in disrepair."

"Hark! A word of warning, let this place beware,
For those who seek a meal most fair and rare.
A pesto shrimp spaghetti, with flavor so bland,
Did leave my taste buds in a barren land.
The noodles, devoid of zest, did taste like card,
And left me wondering, what sorcery had marred.
The calamari, a saving grace, did please,
But service, par, with nary a increase.
A three-star rating, I do proclaim,
For this eatery, a shameful name."

"Wanted to hit this spot for a bit. Got a good table in the lounge, band was setting up. Ordered some tacos - carne asada and pork were alright, shrimp was decent. Beer was overpriced ($17 pitchers), but the ambience made it worth it. Place was sweltering, though. And, oh yeah, asked for a bottle of Bud Light and got a can instead. Next time, I'm heading to America's Taco Shop for their killer carne asada."

We hit up Surrender for MDW, eager to catch Calvin Harris. Prepaid tix got us in quick, even though we rolled up at 11:30pm. But once inside, the vibe fizzled fast.

The outdoor setup was cool, but the execution sucked. Calvin was spinning at the indoor part of the club, but nobody could hit the dance floor unless they shelled out $3000 for a table. What's the point of letting people in if they can't even dance? A waste of cash on the cover, and it wasn't cheap either - $100 for dudes and $40 for ladies. Skip this joint and find a better spot to get your groove on.

"I came back for round two, thinking maybe things had changed. But nope, same old story. Ordered the Green Chile cheeseburger, and the waiter warned me it'd be hot. Yeah, okay, whatever. So I get it, and it looks like they just threw some food on a plate. Sloppy as hell. I take off the top bun, and there's barely any green chile. Ask for a side, and it shows up. It's hot, but it tastes like straight out of a can. Gross. My girl's meal wasn't much better. She got some Green Chile Chicken thing, and it looked like a mess. Rice, beans, cheese, and some chicken soup or something. She said it was too salty. Not New Mexican food, just Tex-Mex with Hatch chile."

"Hark! What's this? A sign doth boast, 'Best Carne Asada in Phoenix', yet the fare doth fall far short of such grand claims.  Alack! The staff, so disinterested in serving guests, doth make one wonder how they keep their doors open.  And when at last my burrito doth arrive, 'twas tiny, a mere morsel, and lacking in both flavor and texture.  Alas! The lime wedge, once a symbol of zest and vitality, doth now resemble a shriveled, lifeless thing.  In truth, this meal doth leave much to be desired.  How false, that sign! Forsooth, 'tis naught but a cruel jest."

"Lucille's BBQ in Vegas, now that's some good eatin'. Pot Liquor? Not so much. Big portions, big prices, but nothin' special. Had the spare ribs, decent, but not worth the price. Service? Meh, typical. Don't get your hopes up if you're plannin' on goin' there."

"Two stars, alack, for this, the worst of three,
That I have visited, with mine own eyes,
The usual SS dishes, they do have,
But Calamari, oh wherefore art thou?
In Chicago, 'twas the most delectable treat,
But here, alas, 'tis nowhere to be found,
A grievous fault, indeed, and cause for woe,
That doth detract from yonder culinary joy.

The location, too, doth leave much to be desired,
Inside a mall, with naught but shops nearby,
And atmosphere, that doth lack a certain fire,
That doth make dining here, a sorry plight.
In Chicago, Miami, swanky, cool, and fun,
But here, in Vegas, doth feel like Legal Seafood's done.

Alas, poor restaurant, with potential great,
Doth fall short, with flaws, so evident and clear,
If thou art in Vegas, choose another spot,
For this one doth not merit thy attention, dear."
"Food's not bad, but overpriced. Like Olive Garden or Red Lobster, but with some extra frills. Great service, though. 5 stars for that."

"Vegas, baby! Wanted an Eiffel Tower drink, but no way, José! Stickin' with Fat Tuesday from now on. This drink's a joke, folks. You wanna get plastered quick? Sure thing! But let me tell ya, it's gonna cost ya. $16.99 for a drink that'll leave ya feelin' like crap. And don't even get me started on the mix. Guy just dumped a bunch of booze at the bottom of the cup and topped it off with strawberry daiquiri. I poured out the last bit myself. No thanks, pal. If ya want the cup, sure thing. But for the alcohol? Fat Tuesday's your best bet."

"This theater's a pain in the ass, that's why I don't come here often. It's hard to find, tucked away in some alley. And once you're inside, it's a mess. Popcorn's not even warm, just sitting there in a display case. Seats are tiny and uncomfortable. Place could use a good scrubbing too. I was the only one watching the movie, felt like a fool. Not worth the trouble, I'll stick to other theaters."

"Nice joint. Big, clean rooms. Service? Not so much. Stuffy vibe, unfriendly staff. Checkout chick didn't give a damn. No 'how was your stay?' or 'thanks for choosing us.' Just handed over the bill like she was doing us a favor. I ain't hard to impress, but for what we paid, some fake hospitality would've been nice."
"Slow service in the a.m. Stand in line 15 min for a cup of joe with only two others ahead. Friendly, but can't multitask worth a damn. Bad combo for a café."

"Hark, my sandwich did take a mere half-hour to arrive! By Jove, 'tis a wonder, a feast fit for the gods! Yet, alas, my friends do swear by this place, and I, a humble bard, doth find it lacking. The din, the noise, doth make it hard to hear, to converse with one's neighbor. The serving maid, she doth bring forth sustenance, and doth present the bill, but doth not ask if aught be needed. No refills, no ale, nay, not even napkins. Rudeness personified, I say! If thou dost not wish to tend to guests, then, prithee, why art thou here? The only virtue, methinks, lies in the multitude of televisions, each displaying a different sport, a true delight!"
"Premium? Hell no. This joint's outdated. Selection's dull. Indoor mall's nice in summer, but North Outlets kicks its ass. More interesting stores or I'm skipping it."
"Gym's near my place, good neighborhood. Cardio machines galore. Treadmills too. Trainers pester ya though. Tryin' to sell their services. Two calls yesterday. Cancelin' my membership tomorrow."

"Lunch at Carson Street Cafe was a bust. My wife and I have been coming here for years, but today was a disappointment. Service was slow and the waiter didn't seem to care. My Cobb salad was flavorless, but my wife's Oxtail Stew was better. The service was subpar, which is unusual for this place. I'm worried it'll become just another overpriced joint now that it's under new management. It's a shame, I've always liked the Golden Nugget."

"WHA WHA! Didn't wait long 'cause I was with six girls, but then found it was a twenty-dollar cover. Since it was late, we decided to skip it, but as we were walkin' out, got handed free passes, so we turned around and went back in. Awesome interior, but the point of a nightclub is to dance. Can't do that when you're packed in like sardines. Don't care how good you look comin' in, you'll look nasty if you're sweaty and wasted. Might be a strategic move to push your way into the crowd, though, 'cause it's hard to fall down with all those people holdin' you up. Those girls in the pools are real depressin', too. When nice girls say hi and ask how you're doin' and you just stare ahead and strike a pose, you look like you've been trafficked. Either that or you gotta get wasted to make it through your shift."

"Coke doesn't bother me. Been here a few times, always mediocre. Last time, ordered a medium #1 with rings through the drive-thru. Guy didn't ask what I wanted to drink, just gave me a Coke. Whatever. Opened the bag, found fries instead of rings. Told him, no big deal. He grabbed some rings, handed 'em over. That's it. You get what you pay for, I reckon. Might give 'em another shot since it's close to home, but underwhelming, for sure."

"Alas, my visit to this place didst not bode well,
For all around me, others didst revel.
Perhaps I chose a day most foul and ill,
But still, my grievances shall be told.

The vegetables, oh how they didst disappoint,
I had to search through them with great intent.
Carrots and tomatoes, both didst lack sheen,
And sweet and sour sauce, didst taste most lean.

But service, that didst make up for some ill,
Our server, friendly and diligent still.
She didst check on us with regular pace,
And with a smile, didst brighten up the space.

So mayhap, fortune shall smile upon me,
Next time I dine, it shall be a bounty.
Till then, alack, this visit doth beset,
A memory, not so fond, doth linger yet."

"Went to this joint with my fiancée. Ordered steak omelets. Hers came loaded with steak, mine had three measly pieces. Asked 'em about it, they said it's pre-weighed. Bullshit. Pointed out the difference in our plates, told 'em I want my money's worth. They brought me a side of steak bits. Twenty minutes later. Rude as hell."

"Went on a weekday for dinner. Service was mediocre, same with the grub. Nothin' special. Place is old, smells funny when you walk in. More of a dive bar than a restaurant. Better options for oysters and other eats."

"Five stars? Don't get it. Food's as dull as a butter knife. 'Spose to be Vietnamese, but where's the flavor? Spices, herbs, all that jazz. None of that here. Jeff's got too much salt, like they emptied a shaker on it. Salt on Vietnamese? No thanks. In town for the weekend, so might come back. Liked the spring rolls, though. Vegas and vegans, not a great combo."

"Decent grub, but the wait's a bitch. Rush hour's a joke, feels like a damn cafeteria line. Too many self-important folks takin' up space. Parking lot's a mess, too. They shoulda moved to a bigger joint by now. Pricey, too. Two stars, tops."

"Grocery store nearby. Open 24/7, but don't count on it. Odds are they'll be out of what you need or stopped carrying it. Unreliable for essentials. Try Harris Teeter or Trader Joes instead. Good for basics like creamer, milk, eggs. Maybe. Watch out for cashiers, known for overcharging and ignoring coupons. Keep an eye on your bill."

"Been here plenty. Craved Pei Wei for days. Finally went, got lettuce wraps and a spring roll. Fast service, but wraps tasted off. Not good. Spring roll was meh. Ginger was there, seaweed too chewy. Disappointed. No rush to return."
"Went for a quick dinner, place was dead. Took us 20 minutes to get sat, hostess was snotty. Food was good, though."

"Alas, this eating house didst fall short of greatness,
With prices of $17 and more, I didst expect a feast.
I ordered Gorgonzola chicken pasta, anticipating
A dish most rich and creamy, yet it didst not meet my hopes.
'Twas naught but cafeteria fare, a bitter disappointment.

But lo, they were most kind to children, a boon indeed.
Their bread was good, and clams, a tasty appetizer, didst please.
My husband, too, didst enjoy his prime rib, a hearty meal.

Yet still, the pasta, which I didst expect to be divine,
Didst fail to impress. Alas, the price didst not align.
The staff, in fairness, didst attend to our each need,
But oh, the food, it didst not justify the cost, I do declare."

"Hark, what woe is this? My locks, they do proclaim
A tale of woe, a story of shame.
For every time I come to this place,
They do butcher my hair, with nary a trace
Of skill or art, they hack and they chop,
Leaving me in a state of utter hop.

A good haircut, it doth take its time,
Fifteen to twenty-five minutes, a fair rhyme.
But here, they rush and they hurry,
In and out in five minutes, oh so sorry.
I'll ne'er return, no more shall I grace
This place with my presence, such disgrace."
"Shrimp wonton with ramen noodles. Good portion, but the broth lacked flavor. Disappointing, given the rave reviews."

"I don't review a joint until I've been there at least twice. But, if I ain't plannin' on goin' back, I'll make an exception. 

I gave 'em two stars 'cause I was feelin' pretty rough from a week-long stomach flu and thought this place might help me break my fast. Turns out, it wasn't the best choice. Don't know if they got good grub, but I ain't goin' back to find out. 

I ordered five tacos, a decent deal for $4.95. Thing is, they were deep-fried taquitos, not real Mexican tacos. Liked the cheese, guac, and lettuce, but didn't care for what it was sittin' on top of."

"Five guys, you're still falling short. Nowhere near as good as Virginia. Gave you another shot tonight and it's like, where's the beef? Thin patties and I gotta order a regular cheeseburger just to taste the damn thing. Should be able to get a small cheeseburger and still taste the burger. Gonna give you another six months or so before I write you off completely. Sad, real sad."

"Sat down for breakfast. No service for ten. Unsure whose section we were in. Food was mediocre. Had to ask four times for water. Decent dinner before. May return for dinner. Better breakfast spots in town."

"First night in Vegas, tough to tell if it was day or night. Hunger pangs, daze, and delirium had us in its grip. No clue how we ended up here, but this joint was a steal - cheap, packed with options, and screaming for a facelift. Slot machines drain your wallet? Come here, eat cheap. Eight bucks a pop, that's the price."

"I got a facial at the Arizona Grand Spa, and two days later, my face was a mess. I'd bought some of their products, too, so I called 'em up to see if I could return 'em. The girl on the phone said she'd have to check, but then she told me I could bring 'em back and they'd give me a credit voucher. I went back the next day, and they gave me the voucher, but then they said they had to check with the manager to make sure it was cool. Four days later, they finally called me back and said it was all good, but I still haven't gotten the check. No one seemed to care that I'd spent a bunch of money on a facial and now my face was all screwed up. They were just worried about their stupid return policy. I won't be going back there anymore."

"Arrived at Four Peaks. Regulars raved about it. Interesting joint, worth a look. Good crowd, not too busy. Menu had some unique options. Food was solid, nothing special. Server was a total bore, zero enthusiasm. Asked for a to-go box, they plopped it down and split. Maybe after a few cold ones, I'd appreciate it more. Plenty of other spots in Tempe, no need to return. Reminds me of that old saying, 'Buy me another drink, you're still ugly.' Server wasn't buying."

"Lola Lo's alright, had some good times there. Friendly bar staff, tasty cocktails, and a pretty atmosphere. But it's pricey, cover charge is steep, and the music's often too soft or just plain bad. Dance floor's too small for a real club experience. Wouldn't choose to go here, but won't say no if others want to."
"Restaurant empty, dinner rolls burnt, Chicken Parmesan overcooked. Four of us, none pleased with meals. Vegan friend requested plain noodles, veggies, cheese added. #fail"

"Been comin' here 23 years, kid. Used to be my favorite spot. Chili cheese dog, can't beat it. But it's changed. Now it's just another overpriced fast food joint. Lost its charm, you know? If I wanna spend five bucks on a dog, I'll hit up the pirate game instead."

"Fair patio, with fountains soft and sweet,
Yet, alack, the scent of chlorine doth greet,
Our nostrils, at dinner, with displeasure,
And mar our joy, with its unpleasant measure.

The victuals, middling, yet passable, were brought,
By a serving-man, with Yelp's gift, unsought,
A burrito, green chili chicken, we did choose,
Laden with cheese, our arteries did froze.

Alas, the flavors, save cheese and heat, did hide,
And chicken, in that mass, did quietly reside,
But, for the patio's charm, and water's song,
This place, in business, might not tarry long."

"Stayed at the Westin, used to be good, not anymore. Free parking, comfy beds, Starbucks in the lobby, that's why we went there for Furniture Market. But now, service sucks. Room had crappy AC, temp didn't change, slept hot and sweaty. They tried to fix it, didn't work, finally got it right after two tries. Other issues, dirty floor, trash left out, weak coffee. Not worth it, life's too short."

"Last eve, we dined at Kaiten sushi, a place unfrequented by the masses, it seemed. Forsooth, the victuals were passable, but naught exceptional, save for the saba, which did impress. Methinks, however, that the rolls were not freshly made, a defect most vexing. 'Tis a wonder they had them prepared beforehand, forsooth. Alack, the signage was scant, and hidden 'twas, behind a row of buildings, in a parking lot, no less! Mayhap this explained the dearth of patrons. Yet, within, 'twas clean and fair, the staff, attentive and friendly, in sooth."

"Hark, fair friends, I pray thee, listen well,
For I have tale to tell, of pizza, foul and fell.
In Chicago, city of the wind,
I lived six months, and pizza, I did find.
A small pie, I ordered, with corn dog, too,
My love, he did enjoy, with pizza, he did chew.
But lo, the pizza, it was not so fine,
Thick on the bottom, thin on the sides, a crime.
Like pie, it should be, but alas, 'twas not,
A disappointment, akin to frozen thought.
We had one slice, and threw it away,
For Giordannos, or Lou Malnati's, it did not stay.
So, if thou art in search of pizza, true,
Avoid this place, my friends, anon, adieu."

"Prices skyrocketed since my last visit. Twenty-one bucks for a meatball burger and fries?! Twenty-three for a goat cheese Caesar with chicken?! And don't even get me started on the Chinese chicken salad for twenty-one dollars. Side of fries for nine bucks?! Ridiculous. Sure, the place looks nice and some of the grub is decent, but at these prices, I just can't see it lasting. And let's not forget the sixteen dollar club sandwich with fries when this joint was still Augustus Cafe. What a joke. I went to Mon Ami Gabi instead and got a fantastic steak and fries at a beautiful outdoor table for twenty-five bucks. Give me a break."

"Tried this joint three times now. Close to home, so thought it'd be convenient. First two times, no big deal. Today though, they got my order wrong - again. And forgot some of my grub. Not worth the drive back. Giving up on this dump."

"Alas, how vexing! After hearing much praise,
My heart did yearn to partake of their fare.
But lo, the dishes that did grace our plates,
Did leave me feeling woeful and quite irate.

The corn, once frozen, now lay mushy and still,
And tacos, seasoned strange, did naught fulfill.
Yet one dish, my husband's burger, did please,
Hot and juicy, a savory delight, indeed.
We devoured it, and the rest, we did dismiss."

"First visit, not great. Just OK. Ordered deep-fried, got sautéed mess. Flavor good, but tough eggplant skin. Service meh, no smiles or thanks. Like they didn't care. Guy with glasses, maybe owner, acted annoyed when we asked about menu. Jerk. Might give it another shot, but doubt it."

"First timer here. Called in the order, they said 20 minutes. Perfect, that's my lunch break. Got there, guy said a couple more minutes. Waited 10, then he says he needs to make the shakes. Another 10, and I'm already past my break. Food takes 45 minutes, not worth it. Frozen custard shake? Nope, cheap ice cream. Not impressed. Food's alright, but too greasy. Don't think I'll be back."

"Ten silver coins for a meal most plain? Aye, 'tis a price most steep, I say. Chicken sandwich, with lettuce, tomato, and bun, yet naught but common fare, I fear. And salad, small, with naught but greens and dressing, doth not a feast make. Meh, I say, to such a meager repast. I shall return, perchance, another day, with hope that fare more grand doth wait."

"Verily, good sir, thy ambiance doth please mine eyes,
And yonder view, 'tis a wondrous sight to behold.
Thy wait staff, too, doth serve with grace and poise,
But alas, the rib eye steak, a disappointment doth unfold.

In sooth, the price doth rival that of Ruth's Chris or Flemings,
Yet the steak itself, doth pale in comparison, I do reckon.
'Tis a shame, forsooth, that such potential doth go awry,
And leaves me in search of a better cut, ere long to say goodbye."

"Hit Mac's for the third time since movin' to CLT three years ago. Had to write about it. In my opinion, overrated. Had the brisket the first two times, tough and chewy, not much of it. Supposedly the best in town, but I ain't seen it. Sides, meh. Went with pulled pork this time, just so-so. Better in town many times. So why two stars? It's a fun place, cool atmosphere, great beer list, good service, music just right. Will I go back? Probaby if I'm in the area, but not worth goin' outta my way for."

"Food was decent, four stars maybe. Service though, one star. Server was nice, but kitchen was a mess. Order took thirty minutes, and it trickled out over the next fifteen. Management's got some serious issues. Someone needs to teach 'em how to run a tight ship. Good thing I don't live in Phoenix, won't have to deal with this again."

"Went outta my way for this joint. Seemed decent at first. But then, cold mashed potatoes and mediocre meat. Sweet tea and cornbread were good, but that's where the praise ends. Not worth the trip. Best BBQ in the West? Don't believe it."

"Papa Del's: Crowded, loud, and slow service. Staff's got attitude, like they're doing you a favor. But hey, their deep dish is decent, especially when you reheat it the next day. And if you're visiting from out of town, it's worth trying. Just don't expect too much from the staff. They ain't exactly friendly."

"O, Bay City Diner, how I do miss thee! 

Du Pars, a place of sustenance, yet priced so high, 
For breakfast, simple fare doth not justify 
The cost, three friends and I didst pay, oh me! 
Above $50, a sum most grave, for mere eggs, toast, 
And pancakes, naught but common fare, I do declare. 

And dinner, too, doth suffer from such prices, 
A diner, plain and simple, on Fremont Street, 
Not the strip, where luxury doth reign supreme, 
Yet Bay City once, a place of good cheer, 
Now lost, alas, to Du Pars' steep fee."

"Employees get the star, but SAMs and Walmart? They fail big time when it comes to clothes for larger folks. Sorry, but we're a bigger nation now and we deserve better. They charge more and don't even carry sizes that fit most of us. It's discrimination, plain and simple. Time to step up and treat us equally."

"Service good, food no. Pasta undercooked for all 14 of us. Other customers sending meals back too. Manager said they're using new pasta, gotta learn how to cook it. Gave us a break on the bill though."
"Room, big. Bed, decent. Sofa, beat-up. Shower, crap. Booked it for the price, three stars on Expedia. But no way it's four stars. Food, crappy. Won't be back."

"This joint one of the cheap buffet spots on the strip? Yeah. Food as good as the others? Nah. Everything my wife and I had for breakfast was bland, dry, and cold. Selection's limited too. If you're lookin' for a place with a ton of options, keep lookin'. Other buffets might cost more, but at least the grub's better and you got more to choose from. Only upside here's savin' a few bucks."

"Two stars for this joint? That's generous. The view's nice, sure, but that's where the charm ends. Waitstaff clueless about fine dining, calamari overcooked, and don't even get me started on the loud gum-smacker refilling our water. Pasta had unmelted cheese chunks, escargot was burnt, steak was mediocre, and they ran out of half their desserts. Stuck in the '70s, they are. Save your cash, enjoy the view from afar, and find a better spot to eat."
"My Mother's cooking? Bland as me. Lasagna, flavorless. Garlic bread, hard as rock. Salad, wilted. But that chocolate cream pie? Heaven. Made me think she farmed out the baking."

"Nick's has been a hotspot for my crew. I've had their pies, calzones, and chicken parm. Solid eats. 

Last night, I wanted to mix it up, so I went for the baked ziti with meatballs. Not worth it. The pasta was overcooked, rubbery, and dry. The ends were rock hard and crunchy. The meatballs were the only saving grace. 

Despite the subpar grub, the service was top-notch."
"Meat dishes? Lamb kebab and chicken 65, no thanks. Paneer tikka masala, plenty of gravy but only eight cubes of paneer. Chana masala, just okay. Naan, fresh and soft."

"Underwhelmed by the grub and vino selection. This iPad wine list business is baloney! Can't even find the right bottle, and the choices are slim pickings. Not worth calling itself a wine bar. 

Had the seared tuna, green beans, flatbread, and battered shrimp. Tuna and greens were alright, but the rest was subpar. Reminds me of an overpriced Applebee's with wine, as others have said. 

Menu hasn't changed in years. Desserts? Forget about 'em."
"Creeps? Good. Coffee and OJ? Excellent. Service? Slow, even with just two tables. Pricey too."

"Tis a strange and wondrous sight, my friends,
This show with its service so poorly tended.
We had tickets for a certain row,
But lo, they were not to be found, oh woe!

The ticketing system, it seemed, had failed,
And duplicates were printed, tales unveiled.
We searched for an usher, our guide,
To find our seats, our place to reside.

At last, a kindly usher appeared,
And led us to a distant seat, so queer.
Betwixt families, we sat and watched,
As the show began, its tale unclocked.

A silly spectacle, full of laughter,
With pandas dancing, acrobatics to scatter.
No story, it seemed, just random play,
Confusion reigned, night turned to day.

My favorite moment, a man did beat,
A panda, oh so cruelly, to retreat.
Alas, not worth the price, my friends,
Unless free tickets, or discounts, it ends."

"Applebee's bugs me. Chain restaurants, cookie-cutter experiences. Why bother? Try something new, unique. Risk it not being great. Better than some overplayed song about baby back ribs. Or Chiles. Same diff. Only went for happy hour. Decent, but can't stand the joint. HH hours: 3-7, 10-midnight. Otherwise, gross."

"Salon's alright, but not my cup of tea. Guy who cut my hair was friendly, but highlights were a mess. Asked for natural, got bleached-out, orange, light brown, and blonde patches. Wouldn't go back, even to fix it. Went elsewhere to get it corrected, which I wish I didn't have to do. Place was clean, staff was friendly, but color service was subpar. That's why I can't give it a high rating."

"Sushi was mediocre. Service was atrocious. Painfully slow. Messed up my order, didn't even say sorry. Took 'em 25 minutes to grab our dessert order, and they couldn't be bothered to check on us again. No thanks, won't be back."

"Z Pizza, you're nothing special. Rubbery salty crust, mediocre slices. Staff doesn't give a damn if I'm there or not. Owner's too busy to care about my late lunch order. Organic, gluten-free options? Don't make me laugh. I want pizza that's tasty, not healthy. That's why I'm eating pizza, not a salad. You're not fooling anyone with your hype. Your food's just so-so at best. I'll keep ordering elsewhere."
"You know what you're getting with Domino's Pizza. It's not the best, but you know that going in. It's like a familiar friend in a strange land. You can count on it, even if it's a bit salty."

"Mom and I hit this joint the day before my weddin' 'cause we wanted somethin' fancy, not like my usual Vietnamese spot. Place looked nice, but for seventy-five bucks a pop, it was a damn waste. My French mani looked like I did it myself, and Mom's wasn't much better. I went with a solid color on my toes instead, and even that was botched. Everyone spoke English and the place looked swanky, but the mani-pedi game was weak. Won't be goin' back, and I was pretty pissed after leavin', but didn't have time to get it redone before the big day. Hopin' the crappy job don't show up in the photos."

"Crusty sheets, burnt out lights, staff barging in on us like they owned the place. Construction racket at dawn, security thugs banging on doors, shouting like they meant business. Housekeepers trying their luck, no regard for privacy. Overpriced, dingy rooms. Not worth the sleepless nights."

"Spicy Shrimp Tacos, three of 'em, topped with guac and slaw. Rice and beans, but I stuck with rice. Menu said "spicy," but it was a lie. Not a single sweat drop. (eye roll) Heard you can mix and match tacos. Shrimp, pork, carne asada, that's my trio. Friendly waitress, clueless hostesses. Standing there, waiting, like a fool. Prices too steep, $15 a plate. Next time, elsewhere."
"Moved here, liked it. Friendly staff, no doubt. But get my drink right, guys. Twice in two days, wrong order. That's not The Bux way. Sorry."
"Food, good. Service, not so much. Four on duty, seven patrons, twenty minutes for the bill? Ridiculous. Try it out."

"At Super Burrito, I didn't love my grub. But, I gotta say, some dodgy characters crashed my taco inspection. We rolled in around 2 AM on a Friday, and as soon as I introduced myself, these three yokels started jabberin' away. They wouldn't shut up, even after we got our food and sat down. It ended with the police showin' up. Got a few minutes of 'em on video, though. Check it out at thtacoreview.com. My tacos were just okay, but we'll give 'em another shot."

"Paradise Bakery, usually good for a quick lunch, but this location needs work. Service is fine, but the food's subpar. Iced tea's stale, watered down, and tastes like crap. Compared it to the one at PV Mall, and it's like night and day. Chicken salad's a letdown too, strawberries and pineapple are soggy and drenched in syrup. Not exactly what I'd call paradise. Might skip this place next time I'm in the area."

"Hark, good sir! What say thee, Sandy, pray tell?
A pox upon this chatter, let us eat with haste,
For yonder grill doth cook the meat apace,
And time doth flee, leaving naught but waste.

Indeed, my friend, 'tis true what thou dost say,
That here at KBBQ, men pay to cook and serve,
But lo, the servers do assist in this fray,
Placing meat upon the grill, their duty to preserve.

Yet, alack, the cooking time, it doth consume,
All conversation, save for grunts and chews,
No waiting, no respite, the pace doth plume,
Ain't nobody got time for that, 'twain't no boon.

And thus, my friend, our AYCE choice did seem,
Rushed, like a tempest, swift and wild, no gleam,
Of calm, save at the start, when water we did seek,
And at the end, when payment we did entreat, aye, meek.

So, mayhap not the best first and last impression made,
Yet still, the meat, it was delicious, not afraid,
To savor it, and thus, my tale is told,
Of Honey Pig, where cooking's the gold."

"Bf and I hit up Emeril's before the KA show. Convenient spot, inside the MGM where KA was playing. Our server, friendly as can be. I guzzled water like it was going out of style. Never let my glass get empty. Had the tuna tacos, not impressed with the sweetness and the steep price tag. Side of mushrooms, overpriced at nine bucks. Mozzarella salad, perfect balance. Light, flavorful."

"Methinks 'tis one of closest Wendy's to our humble abode, yet my dearest wife and I doth not frequent this establishment as oft as we once did, forsooth. Our orders, alas! have been incomplete, with sandwiches either cold or burnt, and salads wilted beyond recognition.

"Moreover, the lights that doth illuminate the restaurant and the drive-through doth dim and darken ere the night doth reach its prime, leaving us to wonder if indeed 'twere open for business. And on a recent eve, we didst venture forth to partake in their culinary delights, and lo! we were the sole patrons, and yet, the service didst falter and fail, with mistakes aplenty.

"Verily, anon, should the quality and service improve, we wouldst gladly return, forsooth."

The architecture's pleasant, elevator tunes and frills, but the staff's a letdown. Rude and dismissive, they snub customers or turn away without a word. Yesterday, I searched for a book, the computer claimed two copies remained, yet no one assisted me. Thank God for Amazon, they earned $80 from me, a savings of $10. Indigo received nothing and won't anytime soon.

"Sakana, twice now. First, lunch sushi special. More than enough, ten bucks. Cali rolls, standouts. Others, average. Returned for Cali rolls, unagi, edamame. Fresh, thirty minutes old. Unagi, huge, warmed, delicious. Service, slow. Drink refill, waited. Average. Sushi lunch special, yes."
"Grub was decent. Service, though? Pure garbage. Took damn near an hour for our food to arrive. Avoid Saturdays like the plague. Drive a bit further and hit up the joint in Chandler instead."

"CityCenter left me unimpressed. Lacking character, it felt like a soulless Wynn or Bellagio. Aria, tucked away, hard to find. Pretty waterfall, but what's the point if it's hidden? I felt out of place, my inner snob screaming 'I shouldn't be here.' Too big, too impersonal. Glad I saw it, but theory didn't translate to reality."

"Lunched there a couple weeks back. Overpriced, slow, and unimpressive. Reuben was nothing special. Almost died of thirst. Better off hitting up the late-night scene. They got half-decent stouts and livable tunes on weekends."

"Alas, our feline friend didst fall ill,
And we, in sorrow, didst seek aid from the ARL.
The receptionist, with voice so cold and unfeeling,
Didst tell us that euthanasia was our only option,
And that we should wait by the door, for someone to meet us.
A woman came forth, and took the carrier away,
With nary a word of comfort or sympathy.
No kindness was shown, no gesture of solace,
Not even a moment's pause, ere they took our cat away.
It was a day of utmost woe, and the ARL's staff,
Didst make it worse, with their lack of compassion and tact.
Two stars, perchance, for the service they provide,
But naught else, save for the memory of their uncaring ways, doth linger."

"Orange Sky, good experiences, but not on Nov. 1. Service decent, but confusion over water service. Food, lobster bisque, king crab, steak, tasted good, but both my wife and I got violently ill within four hours. Reported to hostess, she didn't care. Told management too, they didn't give a damn either. Pricey place, I'd pick somewhere else. Other restaurants take food safety seriously, not Orange Sky. We were there for a special occasion, not even half full, and they sat us next to the bathroom."

"Verily, I have beheld worse spectacles, yea, even much worse than this. Yet, this one still left me underwhelmed. 'Twas not without its clever moments, nor its share of intriguing concepts. At times, I thought, "Marry, that was somewhat cool!" But alas, the overall effect was akin to a deflated balloon, leaving me with the thought, "Is this all there is to it?"

Children may find delight in this show, to be sure. But for adults, I would recommend instead the wondrous productions of Cirque du Soleil, such as O, Mystere, or Love. Or, if thou art in search of magic and mirth, seek out Penn & Teller at the Rio, or the enigmatic Amazing Johnathan, wherever he may be found.

I would not see Blue Man Group again, not even for naught. Forsooth, the hype doth far exceed the substance."

I called on Execu Car for a work trip in Phoenix. They're affiliated with SuperShuttle, you know. My assistant made the arrangements. I got picked up at the airport, dropped off at a site, and then back to the airport. Three hours, $135 before tip. The driver was pleasant, no issues. Just your run-of-the-mill car service.

"Bah. Don't know. Overpriced grub, mediocre at best. Been in Vancouver too long, spoiled by cheap, good eats. People suggestin' restaurants must be makin' bank. Not impressed with Lemeac. Thirty-six bucks for an entree? Where's the salad, dessert? Lobster, maybe. But that's the norm here, or so they say. Haven't found no amazin' food joints yet. Guess I'm a VanCity girl now."

"Alas, my visit to this place didst leave much to be desired. Forsooth, the Kung Po Shrimp lacked flavor, though the crustaceans themselves were cooked well. And the Hunan beef, oh how it left a strange film upon mine tongue! Verily, I say, 'twas not worth the price, for each dish didst cost more than ten silver pieces. Nay, I shall not return to partake in their dine-in fare."

"Went to Benny's with my kid for brekkie. Ordered the usual - scrambled eggs, bacon, toast, home fries. Eggs were mushy, bacon was scrawny. My kid liked the home fries, but I prefer 'em hash brown style. Coffee was piss poor, like you'd expect from a greasy spoon. Paid full price, ten bucks a pop. Felt like I got ripped off, like they cooked everything in the microwave. Service was meh, our waitress disappeared after she brought the grub. Won't be going back to Benny's for breakfast. Disappointed I wasted my cash."

"Friendly service, big portions. But the grub? Hit or miss. Veggies, nice and fresh. Meat and seafood? Not so much. Shrimp, too greasy. Chicken, overcooked and flavorless. Stick to veggie dishes, that's my advice."

"Hark! A tale of woe doth come from Crandall's,
Where I, a hungry soul, didst order meals.
Via Grubhub, I didst choose their fare,
But alas! Their service doth leave much to bear.

The first time, I didst enter the wrong address,
And called the restaurant to make amends.
But they, in rudeness, didst deny my plea,
And told me I had the wrong place, indeed.

The second time, I waited for an hour,
But they, in foolishness, didst run out of power.
They called to say they had none left,
And left me with naught but sorrow and bereft.

The third time, they packaged my order awry,
And gave me food that didst not match my cry.
When I didst call to ask for the right fare,
They blamed the delivery man, without a care.

I've never had such poor service, indeed,
And feel compelled to write this Yelp review with speed.
For Crandall's doth lack the skill and grace,
To run a restaurant with proper pace."

"Disappointed with service. Arrived early, signed in before a party of three. Ignored. Two of us, no seats at bar. Party of three sat at open table instead. Told table was too big for us.
