Ten minutes later, sat at same size table. No menu, had to order off conveyor belt. Half of it arrived, had to reorder lost items. Bad experience. Only want large parties, had good experiences with big groups in the past."

"Hark, fair citizens of Madison, we doth reside
In yonder downtown, where restaurants doth abound.
Our taste, discerning and refined, doth oft entice
Friends to seek our counsel, in search of gastronomic delight.

At Cento, alas, our expectations were not met,
For service, poor and lacking, did our patience beset.
No silverware, no napkins, empty glasses lay,
And drinks, unfilled, did prompt our dismay.

The bartenders, though pleasant, didst seem bereft
Of teamwork and customer care, to our grief.
Food, good but not great, didst fail to impress,
As service, shoddy, did our experience repress.

A kindly word with the manager, we didst impart,
Who listened with grace and promised a new start.
But lo, a call, he didst not make, to our dismay,
And thus, our trust, didst fade away.

Echo Tap and Big Ten Pub, our faith doth restore,
For service, there, doth rival the best, evermore.
Cento, take heed, and learn from these, thy peers,
Lest customers, like us, dost turn to tears."

Hark! I've just returned from fair London town,
Where I didst indulge in curries renowned.
Now, my taste buds do crave that spicy delight,
And so, I sought out Taza, a place in sight.

Their lunch buffet didst catch my eye, I must confess,
With its diverse choices, a veritable feast.
The service, too, was prompt and most courteous,
And the decor, a pleasant atmosphere, didst engender.

But alas! The food, it didst disappoint,
Dry and lacking flavor, it didst not impress.
Naan and soup, the only dishes that didst please,
Leaving me to pine for London's curries, if you please.

"This joint gets two stars, max. I was already lit when I got there, but I met some cool Asians from Texas. The DJ wasn't half bad either. My girl hooked me up with a double shot of Patron. Other than that, it was a bust. Dead, like a doornail. Can't even remember which hotel it was at."

"I showed up for the standard California Burrito and some Jamaica. Didn't get either. Went through the drive-thru, but the girl taking my order didn't speak my language, so I had to roll down my window and ask about the menu. She didn't speak much English neither, so I settled for a quesadilla. It was alright, can't say it compared to the authentic Mexican grub I get at Vaqueros on 19th and Southern. Food was just alright, my main gripe was the lack of clear English. Customer service was decent otherwise."
"Ramen too salty. Ingredients lost in salt. Shame, nice joint, good service."

"Reserved a table a month ahead for seven, mentioning it was an anniversary dinner. Phoned the night of, asking to push back the time to 7:30 since we were running late. Told we couldn't, had to make it within 15 minutes of the original reservation or no seat. Rushed, made it just in time, and got sat at a big table, likely 'cause all the couple tables were taken. Place was dead empty, only a few other parties. Server was good, but the hostess desk needs work. Food was great, lots of leftovers for lunch the next day. It's a long meal, plan accordingly. Can't do this place quick, it's an experience."

"Alas, my dear lord and I didst venture to the Planet Hollywood hotel, whereupon they didst present us with coupons for their buffet. We didst decide to partake in their morning repast, having heard tell of its excellence. But lo, what a disappointment it was! For all the dishes, nay, every last one, was cold as ice! Our first helping didst include eggs, hash browns, bacon, sausage, biscuits, and gravy, but alas, not a single morsel was warm. We didst leave most of it uneaten, in hopes that a second trip might yield a better result. But alas, 'twas not to be, for all remained as cold as before. A pox upon that buffet, say I! For though the victuals didst taste of promise, who doth wish to consume cold eggs and meat for breakfast? And furthermore, how safe could such food be, if 'tis not kept at a proper temperature? They didst have a fair selection and variety, but alas, 'twas not worth the cost, for who doth wish to dine on cold fare? I shall not return thither."

"Methought, fair sir, upon mine way to Jersey Mike's,  
To stop and view the place, and thus didst decide.  
I ordered three tacos, my comrade two,  
And waited thirty minutes, as patient as a saint.  
The hostess, fair and kind, didst proffer apologies,  
Yet nary a snack or drink didst they provide,  
For which I didst think them somewhat stingy.  
The prices, too, didst seem a mite steep,  
Twelve coins for three tacos, a princely sum, indeed.  
The Al Pastor, verily, didst taste most fine,  
Whilst the Chicken Tinga, alas, didst lack all zest."

"Lonnie's got some real crummy staff. Every damn time I go in there, they're rude, slow, and kick me out when they close. But I keep going back for their top-notch cane glass beads. That's all I care about, so screw the rest."

"A pox upon this Table 10, where doth my expectations lie?

Forsooth, I've supped at Delmonicos, Emeril's Fish House, and more,
Yet still, this place didst fail to meet my lofty score.
I took away a star for taste, another for the service slow,
And one for prices high, yet quality doth not show.
In truth, I shall not darken their door again, no more,
For though 'tis better than the Fish House, 'tis still a sore.
That place, a den of woe, most foul and dismal, maketh me shudder."

"Curbside check-in at the east economy lot. Got there 95 minutes before my flight, waited 6 or 7 minutes, then got turned away 'cause I was 88 minutes from takeoff. Guy running the show wasn't too friendly, said his computer wouldn't let him do it. Seemed like an excuse to slack off. If it's really the computer, they should allow a grace period, five minutes would be good. 

Curbside check-in's a great service, but they're getting pretty strict about the luggage. 

Moral of the story: get there 100 minutes early or you'll be pissed and stressed like I was."

"Walked into a joint for a quick bite. Saw fried this 'n that. Fish wings, shrimp gizzards, etc. Was gonna get some gizzards, but the lady said it was wing day. Looked at their 19 sauces, went with sweet 'n sour. Bland, and three outta five wings were undercooked. Don't reckon I'll be back."

"Ain't impressed much with this joint. Been here a few times, and it ain't all that great. Servers keep comin' 'round with carts full of greasy, fried Chinese grub that may or may not be hot. Service is terrible, and only about one in three dishes is any good. Fried shrimp balls and egg tarts are among the better options. Now, if you're into a Chinese buffet where the servers don't speak English or French, you might like it. Lot of Chinese folks eat here too, so maybe I'm way off base. Some of the fried stuff my friends rave about tastes like lukewarm Chicken McNuggets to me. If you got a group of friends and a couple of pre-dinner drinks, you might enjoy this place. Good for them what wants to eat a lot, like poor college kids or somethin'."

"Dinos? We read about it, thought it'd be a real joint. But no, it's just a dive, a cinder block in the middle of nowhere. It's got a bar, sure, but it's nothing special. At night, it might be okay, I guess, if you're into that sorta thing. But me? No thanks. Dean Martin never drank here, and that tells you something."

"Montreal, a city of delightful cuisine, yet one establishment failed to impress. A friendly face greeted us, but our server, disinterested and defensive, left much to be desired. Pastries and cake, pre-made, took an unacceptable 30 minutes, causing us to be late for our flight. We should have known better than to come here before flying, but who would have thought a simple request for cake would take so long? When we asked politely for it to go, the response was rudeness personified. And, curiously, frappes were listed on the menu, but unavailable for order. Perhaps they lacked a blender, or maybe the server simply didn't feel like making them. The mystery remains."
"I was here last year. Not impressed. Food unmemorable. Atmosphere too casual, flies everywhere. Service forgettable. No reason to come back. Plenty other places to eat at Tempe Marketplace."

"Sat at the bar for dinner before our flight. Food was decent, but overpriced. Could've eaten at Kabuto for what we paid and still been hungry. Paid near $300 for two people, and I didn't even order a drink. Rock shrimp was good, so we ordered another, but it came out soggy and took a while due to the backed-up kitchen. Other sushi was standard. Food was okay, but too pricey. Won't be returning when there are better options off the strip."

We dined at this joint on Sat night with five others. Service was crap, courtesy of a dude named Tommy. He had a crappy attitude, worst I've seen in a while. Salads and apps were meh, drinks were weak. My pops had a bone-in steak that was tough as shoe leather. Took 'em an hour to serve us, and we were pissed about it. Manager Amanda tried to make it right with free desserts and a drink, but that didn't cut it. No excuse for this kinda treatment. Tommy don't belong here, not even in a one-star diner on the strip.

"Awkward, the club doth feel, despite great DJ's brought before.  Shame doth fall upon our town, when globally renowned DJ's come, and lame, the crowd doth prove.  Not the right crowd, nor place, for such grand DJ's, I do perceive.  O, how I wish they'd take their art and move to Bar Smith, where 'twould be done right, methinks."

"Skip this joint if you're lookin' for somethin' more than just a plain crepe. Price ain't worth it. $9 for a mixed berry crepe with a measly three small pieces of fruit. I saw a few crepes laid out, thought the fruit was just for show. Nope, that's all you get. Gelato stand in the Canals is where it's at. Had it five times now, always get the mango sorbet. Light, fluffy, sweet. Damn, I need it now."

"With expectations high, I entered in,
But left, my dear, with disappointment's sting.
The facilities, alas, did not impress,
For Canyon Ranch's name and fee, I must confess.
Take heed, good sir, and spend thy gold
At places better suited to behold."
"Rat hole. Pricey grub from pants-less servers. One star, outta sympathy."

"Twas but a mediocre feast, my friends,
Despite the menu's promise of delight.
The chili and lime shrimp, oh how grand,
And grilled scallops with mango salsa, a true delight.
But alas, the flavors did not impress,
Overpriced, the dishes did profess.
Four pieces of shrimp for fourteen crowns,
Our scallops, undercooked, with frowns.

The servers, friendly and polite,
Attentive, they did ignite.
The decor, striking and fair,
A trendy place, to drink and share.
But alas, the food, a letdown,
Would not entice me, to come around."

"Methinks 'twas a strange and wondrous night,
My visit to BJ's, full of wonder and fright.
For though 'twas not my first time at this place,
I found myself in a most curious space.

Four chairs, all broken, didst greet mine eyes,
A hazard great, and cause for much surprise.
Yet, we began our feast with cheer and glee,
The calamari, a dish most fine and free.

But then, alack! The margarita flat bread,
Didst fail to impress, as once it had.
For 'twas not fresh, nor full of basil's grace,
As once it was, in days of yore and space.

My daughter, she didst order shrimp scampi,
And asked for Parmesan, a simple request, yea?
But lo! They brought her packets, void of sense,
And said they could not find the grater, in their defense.

Alas, poor BJ's, how art thou fallen from grace?
Once a place of wonder, now a place of disgrace.
Two stars, I give thee, for memories past,
But heed my words, and change thy ways, at last!"

"Verily, I knew not where to start, in sooth,
For this east valley tavern, hidden from view,
Didst play hard to find, in a strip mall's midst,
With a gruff visage on the entrance, anon, didst seem uncouth.

Two areas within, for revelry and cheer,
When full, a college party atmosphere doth bring,
But empty, fried food scent and punching doth fill the air,
As youths, in Scottsdale finery, doth congregate, in vain.

A musical evening, I didst attend,
Yet, distractions abounded, my friend,
Televisions, Golden Tee, a punching bag game,
Didst steal my focus, and my thoughts didst become askew.

One drink, a Jameson's, I didst imbibe,
(O, Toby, the price, didst cause me to quip!)
Perplexed, I remained, at this place's intent,
And why, oh why, would they allow punching, during a tuneful event?

A spacious patio, outside, doth beckon,
A larger room, with stage, for music, doth enchant,
And, in a smaller space, darts and pool doth await,
Like Iowa's venue, with diverse delights, in days of yore, didst present.

In Gilbert, perhaps, such diversity doth thrive,
A place for all, or so it doth seem, to survive."

"Alack, my friends, we didst venture forth
To celebrate a comrade's final night of freedom,
And made a reservation, as was meet and right,
For six of us, at a specific hour, with all due speed.

But lo, when we arrived, the woman there
Didst inform us that no such reservation didst exist,
And though she seemed a gentle soul, with nary a care,
She could not help us, nor didst she make amends, alas.

One seat they had, but 'twas a lonely perch,
And hours would pass ere others didst become available,
So we, in sadness, didst depart, with naught to show,
Save for the shaved face of him whose party it didst behold.

Oh, friends, take heed of this tale, and mark it well,
For reservations made may not always be to tell,
And those who do not keep their word, doth bring us woe,
So let us beware, and find another place to go."

"Been craving a killer hot fudge sundae. Saw Rita's had frozen custard, so I gave it a shot. Inside, a young girl told me their flavors. Asked how the custard was, she said "real good." Ordered a kid's hot fudge sundae. Got a small cup with some weak hot fudge on top. Cost me $4.70. Not impressed. It was just thick soft serve, not real custard. Hot fudge was canned crap. Keeping my search going for the best hot fudge sundae in Charlotte."

"Methinks 'tis oft I dine at swift and humble Mexican establishments, forsooth, not fond of Garcias, Macayos, Arribas, and suchlike. Yet, have I sought a genuine, sit-down Mexican eatery of repute, forsooth. Upon espying this place with four stars and a name in fair Spanish, I chose to give 'twill a go. Methoughts, fair Mexicans did dine within! Alack, my joy did wane when chips and salsa arrived, yet, I do strive not to judge by such alone. A plain cheese crisp we did order as an appetizer, and verily, 'twas not so bad; crispy, not oily, in sooth. But lo, the main courses did arrive, and what a disappointment! Tacos, oily, bland; beans, rice, naught better. In conclusion, 'tis but common Mexican fare, fried, insipid, greasy, like most. Naught special, naught authentic, herein. I shall not return, my quest doth continue."

"I stepped into One Love Vapors for the first time in early October. They had just opened, and I was curious. A friendly guy greeted me, and the place had a nice vibe - music playing, clean atmosphere. I tried a few juices and left feeling satisfied.

Fast forward to a week ago, and I finally made it back. The place was dead silent when I walked in. The same guy from before approached me, but his energy was different. He seemed tired, uninterested. I tried a few more juices, but they tasted burnt. Disappointing, to say the least.

Customer service took a nosedive since my first visit. I won't be returning. Two stars for the few decent juices I tried."
"Food was passable, but the joint was a dump. Trash cans overflowed, and tables were littered with garbage. Disgusting."

"Drinks were decent, had the dirty chai. Service, though? Worst I've seen. Felt like I was a burden, took 'em forever to make our drinks. They ignored us, took their time. Considered bailin' multiple times. Won't be goin' back."
"Calvin Klein clothes, good selection. Check specials twice, prices change at register. Agree? I do."

"Sat down, waited 15, water and menus came. Ordered a bloody mary, worst drink in years, undrinkable. Waitstaff described two meals wrong, had to replace them after we finished eating. I got the Chicken Zanagrelli, sounded good, but the chicken was inedible, bad consistency and flavor. They asked if I wanted a box, I said no. Manager came over, apologized, asked how the replacements were, we said pretty good, they should've listened for great or excellent. They tried hard, nice ambiance, but won't be back."

"Methought, fair sir, to visit this place,
For oft I come hither to run my errands with haste.
The interior, neat and tidy, didst please mine eyes,
And the cashier, with a smile, didst welcome me with open arms.

A torta de lengua, I didst order, with great anticipation,
But alas, the dish didst fail to meet mine expectations.
The flavors, dull and uninspired, didst leave me in dismay,
And I fear, I shall not return, ere many a day hath passed away."

"Celebrated my buddy's last night before deployment at this joint. Bouncers were real jerks, took our IDs and said we had to track down the popo to get them verified. Wasted some time with the fuzz, exchange all the necessary info, and finally got my friend in. Too bad about the bouncers, place was pretty sweet."

"First time at Pisces tonight. Food was good, sushi creative. Service, though? Not so much. Watched our sushi sit at the bar for ten minutes while the server did nothing. Finally got our food, but she messed up the order. Asked for extra tobiko, she disappeared. Didn't see her again till the meal was over. Name's on the receipt, won't be sitting in her section next time. Good food don't mean squat with bad service."

"This bar, I love it. Great beer selection, best bartenders. But the music, no good. Not for anyone. Jukebox, that's what they need. Customer picks, you know? Instead, it's like they got a kid playing DJ, skipping through tracks like a fool. Ruins the whole vibe."

"Coffee's great when they get it right, which ain't often. Maybe half the time. Breakfast's good if you got time to kill. But skip lunch, there's better joints around for the same scratch. Staff's friendly, but the line's a mess. They need some serious training or another pair of hands."

"This joint claims to be a 'traditional British pub.' New owners took over an Italian café and tried to make it look the part. Pricey drinks, though. Eight-fifty for a pint of generic beer? You must be joking! They had Murphy's Irish stout, but it didn't taste quite right. Paid twenty-seven bucks for three pints, and that was it for me. Local beer a few blocks away is better and cheaper. Didn't try the food, but my friend said the homemade egg noodles and roasted eggplant ragout were good. Menu looked decent, but not your usual pub grub. Ploughman's Lunch for thirteen bucks, a bit steep. Montreal, so menu's high-end and flashy. All in all, not quite there."

"Pancakes, simple fare - flour, egg, milk, and air. Yet, ten bucks? Overpriced, I'd say. Better to beg a skilled mate to cook up a batch. Better grub, faster service, and no limit on H2O. Only drawback, missing out on a Great Dane's egg-devouring spectacle. That sight, pure gold."

"Pray, good sir, shoot me ere I step foot in this place once more. Forsooth, I know not why I return hither, save for the kind service of the staff. Alas, the victuals! Flattened by a bus, the steaks lie lifeless, cooked well done by force. The din doth pierce mine ears, and chill doth run down mine spine, for 'tis colder within these walls than without, in the city's sweltering heat. Verily, 'tis a woeful place, and I do vow, ne'er shall I darken its doorstep again."

"Came here often, back when they stayed open late. Coffee was crap, usually cold. Even when served fresh. Switched to tea, hoping for something hot. Not even boiled. Disappointing. Like the laid-back vibe, though. Friendly staff too. Hope they step up their game. Won't take customers for granted."
"Ho there, good sir! What say you of this meal? Aye, 'tis but a mediocre feast, with fries o'ercooked and a burger most plain. Naught to boast of, I do declare!"

"A paltry sum, they gave me, of the food I didst crave.
Butter chicken, 'twas, yet o'er salted, I didst perceive.
Seven crowns, a meager ration, they didst demand.
Alack, poor service, and ambiance, they didst not command.
Next time, when hunger doth beset me, and I am near,
I shall eschew their premises, and seek Chipotle's cheer."

"Methinks I do adore Jamba Juice, but alas, this place doth lack. I've visited thrice, and each time, a wait hath been my fate. Last eve, four souls didst precede me, waiting patiently for their draughts, while one lass didst toil, preparing drinks with speed. A strawberry bowl, with granola and fresh fruit, didst I command, yet the cashier, in haste, didst pause, to take another's order, ere completing mine. His hands, unclean, didst don gloves, a foul sight, indeed. Alas, 'tis a pity, for now, to a further spot, I must journey, to quench my thirst for smoothies."

"Alas, poor Sugar & Ice, thy name doth lie,
For naught but woe doth dwell within thy walls.
A place that should be sweet and full of cheer,
Doth bring us naught but bitter disappointment instead.

The menu, limited, doth leave much to be desired,
And he who seeketh sustenance, doth find naught but despair.
The grilled chicken panini, a sorry sight,
Doth prove to be but sliced deli meat, devoid of charm.
The bread, soaked in grease, doth weigh heavy on the stomach,
And cheese and aioli, o'er salted, doth assault the taste.

But lo, if thou art seeking sweets, 'tis not in vain,
For there, thy cravings shall be satisfied, 'twain.
Yet, for a meal or substance more substantial,
Best seek elsewhere, lest thou suffer similar frustration."

"Planet Fitness? More like Planet Shithole. Been to a few locations, but this one takes the cake. Dirty bathrooms, broken showers, and staff who couldn't care less. What a joke. Don't waste your time."

Location, mountain side, nice view, decent parking. Service, good, friendly hostess and waiter. Food quality, rolls and salad, good. Rib eye, not bad, not great, low-grade steak, no crazy spices, edible but not great. Vegetables, not healthy looking. Ambiance, loud, expected that, smelly bull outside. Took the slide, funny. Would I come back, unlikely, glad we tried it, food not enjoyable, not cheap, better options in town.

"Rainy days, we'd hit the racks, me and the crew. Our own little dress-up montage. Fun to browse, but watch out for the snooty clerks. Quality's gone downhill, high-end brands harder to find. Lower-end, Macy's sales or Goodwill's your better bet. Prices here? Steep. Vintage shops or online, you'll find better deals."
"Food subpar, service worse. Had hoped for full dining experience, but Seviche sampler disappointed. Only one of three choices passable. Decor pleasant, but food and service fall short."

"I wanted to like this joint. First timer, my gal had been here before. Ordered a cold one, decent. Calzone, not so much. Asked for sauce on the side, but it came loaded. Don't dig chunky sauce, so I use it sparingly. Inside, it was almost a waste. Middle was cold. Whole experience, bummer. Gal said send it back, but we were in a rush, no time for a redo."

"This ain't no Crowne Plaza. I'm on the fourth floor, king suite, but it feels like I'm in some dingy, run-down motel. Towels are rough, wallpaper's peeling, windowsill's got bugs crawling all over it, curtains are burned, furniture's sagging. Place needs a serious upgrade. Night auditor's clueless, can't even find a luggage cart or extra pillow. I'm stuck here for two more nights, but I'd advise anyone else to steer clear."

"Echo & Rig, gave 'em another shot. Steaks? Top-notch. Cooked to perfection, flavor on point. Service? Not so much. Downstairs, early bird special. Couple bails 'cause no server in sight. Finally, someone shows up, takes our order, then disappears. Leaves us hanging, just like the check."
"Average spread at too steep a price. Thirty bucks a head on weekends. Variety's nothing special, just your standard Vegas fare."

"Underwhelming experience. Went in hoping for a great sports bar within walking distance from the Islands. Happy hour visit, but couldn't get the discounted appetizer due to seating preference. Fajitas were decent, but lacked essentials like beans and rice. Extra charge for additional tortillas, poor communication from the waitstaff. Hubby enjoyed his steak. Plenty of TVs for sports viewing. Service was mediocre."

"Food was good, fresh and well-prepared. Selection was limited, though. Desserts bar was lacking. Heated plates melted the ice cream and chocolate. Service was just okay. Not worth the $25 price tag. $10-15 would be more appropriate."

"Moo shoo pork craving hit me hard last night. Lazy, I opted for takeout from the joint nearby. Devoured it, starved as I was. Onion, oh how it lingered, like a bad habit. Brushed my teeth twice, still, it clung to my breath like a lover's embrace. Chef must've lost his touch, or perhaps he never knew what moo shoo pork truly meant. Shame, really. Place has a rep for being top-notch. Owner should know their chef fell short."

"Sub-par grub and lackluster service. I'll stick to cookin' my own brekkie, thanks. If you're hankerin' for someone else to scramble your eggs, try a nicer joint that prioritizes quality over quantity. This place is massive, but you won't find much joy here. I sure didn't. There are better options nearby, so why bother with this one? It ain't worth the drive."

It was past midnight in Vegas and my stomach was growling. My friend said there weren't any good restaurants open, but we found Wolfgang Puck's place in the MGM. It looked fancy, with big rings out front, but the staff was friendly and busy. I got the mushroom and leek pizza, which hit the spot, but the raw leeks were a bit much. The server took her time bringing me my drink, but the Makers Mark and peach drink was worth it. The menu was pricey and the service was slow, so I wouldn't go back.

"Teriyaki chicken, that's what I came for. Before hitting the road back to LA, gotta fuel up. Quality? Eh, not bad. Smothered in sauce, piled high on rice. A bit salty, but that's how they do it here. They don't mess around, just throw it all together. Cheap, filling, and for the kids. That's their game."

"Hark! What woe is this? My heart doth sink,
For Old Chicago's pizza, once so fine,
Hath now become a shadow of its former self.
Their new Tavern style, a pale imitation,
Doth lack the flavor of their NY-style,
Which they no longer deign to serve.

A pox upon the waitstaff, ignorant and bold,
Who lie to customers with reckless abandon.
I asked if Specialty pizzas were included,
In the half-off deal, a question most innocent.
But lo, the answer given was false,
And our bill, inflated, did cause much vexation.

Farewell, Old Chicago, thy name doth ring,
With disappointment and poor service, a sorry tale.
I shall not return, for pizza so bland,
And mistakes on the bill, do leave a sour taste."

"Vegas, old hotel, overpriced. Loved the buffet, but the rooms? Outdated. Our group got stuck with ancient TVs, big bulky backs. Come on, for that kind of cash? Upgrade already! Shower was pathetic, weak water pressure. Feels like a joke. Never again."

"I gotta disagree with most of these reviewers. Been there four times, introduced by an ex. It's a dive, no sugarcoating it. Can be good or bad. Had some decent grub, but the hookah was subpar. Decor was tacky, servers were newbies. Authentic, but not the best. Food was just okay. Not great, just okay. Don't know if I'd go back."

"Pfft! That's the sound I made after spittin' out some oysters at Vinnie's. The raw ones were alright, not the best taste but they did the trick. The steamed ones, though? Overcooked, rubbery, and tasted like mud. Our server seemed more interested in gettin' off her shift early than takin' care of us. If I ever go back to Vinnie's, I'll stick to foods that can be deep-fried. And where's the raw bar? The server brought us another half bucket of steamed oysters, but she said they were'micked.' Does that mean microwaved? What kind of oyster bar is this?"

"Dry, flavorless, and drenched in frosting. That's my take on the carrot cake. Can't even finish the damn thing without a drink. Frosting's too sweet, like someone poured a whole bag of sugar on top. Two cupcakes, both destined for the trash. What a waste."

"Hark! If thou dost crave the McRib when 'tis not in season, fear not, for Dickey's doth have thee covered! 

Beware, dear friend, the scent of BBQ doth deceive, for Dickey's is to barbecue as Taco Bell is to Mexico's finest fare. 

I ventured forth to Dickey's for luncheon, and ordered thusly: the Westerner, a sandwich of pulled pork and sausage, accompanied by macaroni and cheese, and loaded mashed potatoes. Alas, the sandwich didst not impress, save for the bread, which was quite pleasant. 

Foolish was he who compared Dickey's macaroni and cheese to Krafty's; nay, their concoction of cheese sauce doth pale in comparison. The loaded mashed potatoes, however, were passable, as was the sweet tea. And lastly, I enjoyed a complimentary cone, labeled ice cream, though appearances can be deceiving, for 'twas but a poor imitation of the real thing. 

The service was good, the establishment clean, and prices fair. A fine place for families, indeed. Though I wouldst not make haste to return, a coupon might entice me once again to partake of their offerings. Bon appetit, my friends!"

"Pros: Downtown location, comfy beds. Cons: Lousy breakfast, dirty lounge, unfriendly staff. They got a coffee machine but often run out of cups and sleeves. Some front desk folks are rude. Not great for frequent biz travelers. Disappointing compared to other Starwood & Marriott hotels." (286 tokens)

"Alack, my expectations were not quite met,
At this zoo, where I didst recently set foot.
The signs, they were not clear, and that did vex me,
And many of the creatures, they were not there to see.

The petting zoo, a place of wonder, I thought,
Didst consist but of a pen of goats, alas, no more.
A shame, for I had hoped to see much more,
But nay, 'twas not to be, at this zoo, I didst explore."

"Upon my visit to Whisky River, I found it not to be a shrine to Dale Earnhardt Jr., as I had supposed. 'Twas instead a haven for his fond admirers, a place of pilgrimage for those who hold him dear. A stand within the premises doth sell T-shirts, hats, and other trinkets bearing the name of Whisky River.

"If thou art not a fan of NASCAR, 'tis best to avoid this place during a race, for all 20 televisions within the bar doth show the same.

"Be aware, good sir or madam, that Whisky River doth require a membership, and thou must wait in line and fill out a form to gain entry. A cover charge doth also apply.

"The crowd within doth not dress up, forsooth. Women doth wear jeans and halter tops, while men doth don jeans, collared shirts, and baseball caps.

"Three large bars and several beer tubs doth provide ample space for imbibing drinks, and the mechanical bull doth offer sport and entertainment, especially for the fairer sex.

"A blessing indeed, that Whisky River doth lie close to the light rail, making it easily accessible."

"Came for work, stayed one night. Room needed updating, looked like a bachelor pad from the '80s. Red leather chair, cheap dresser turned entertainment center. Too many mirrors, tiny bathroom counter, no coffee maker. Got a towel with a six-inch hole. If they renovate, doubt MGM will last. Won't be back. PS...hidden $25 fee in the fine print."

You've had one sake too many, can't be arsed with a 90-minute bus ride home? Stumble into the nearest hotel, that's what. In our case, it was the Thistle King James Hotel. Twin rooms were all they had left, so we took 'em.

Passed out on what I'd call glorious mattresses, perfect for me, but the boy wasn't a fan. It was bloody hot, and we couldn't find the thermostat. Not a huge deal for me, but the fact that I felt like I was sleeping next to the pissed bloke outside instead of being separated by concrete and six floors got under my skin a bit.

I've lived downtown before, screaming police cars don't phase me. But soundproofing? That's a different story. This building's age shows in its lack of it. The bird on the counter told us it was due to be knocked down. Not sure how I feel about that, but if it's gonna keep being a hotel, maybe throw in some soundproofing so I don't hear the pop of the champagne bottle next door next time.

"In Tempe's fair city, where I didst grow,
A liquor store didst stand, most wondrous show.
With flashing lights, a sight to see,
And drive-through, for ease and glee.

As youth, I thought it grand, a place to be,
But when of age, I found it not to see.
Thirty stores lay 'twixt home and thee,
So ne'er didst I venture, wild and free.

Groupon, with deal so fine and fair,
Didst tempt me in, with liquor to spare.
I went, and found it not so grand,
A disappointment, in this liquor land.

For those who hasten to ASU's gate,
It may suffice, but not worth the wait.
Prices high, like Las Vegas' fee,
Go elsewhere, and save thy gold, thou shalt see."
"Cold beer, colder burrito. Service? Forget about it. Had to plead for chips and salsa. Avoid this joint."
"Food's good, don't buy retail. Bought an $80 purse, used it a week, strap came apart. Took it back, they said all sales are final. Damn! You can take it, get it fixed. That's something."
"Susihi? Just okay. Freshness lacking. Baked, deep-fried rolls subpar. Service good at first, then zilch. Waitstaff MIA. Meh."

"No Asian food here. Overpriced, mediocre grub near CMU. Popular for no good reason. I tried the pho - sad. Rice with duck was decent, but poorly butchered. Better options in the CMU area. Service needs work too."

"Went there for lunch on the weekend. Place was dead, except for the TVs blasting loud. Couldn't hear myself think, let alone have a conversation. Ordered the french dip. Greasy as hell. Au jus was basically gravy. Tots were decent, though. Crunchy, not too salty. Not worth the trip from my place. Won't be going back."
"Focaccia sandwich, they claimed. Different, they said. Sure wasn't. Burrito, wrap, call it what you want. Not good. Sweet potato chips, bland. Beer, cold. Next time, elsewhere."

"First time in, underwhelmed. Big place, giant beers, eclectic crowd. Recipe for disaster, but it's grown on me. Not my favorite, not even top 20. But it'll do for a casual beer. Weeknights are peaceful, good for a chat and a drink. The Come Back isn't great, but it isn't bad either. It just exists."

"I wanna like this joint, I swear. But three things bug me: their BBQ's just okay, sauces are good but meat's mediocre. Sides are meh, mashed sweet potatoes, potato salad, beans, nothing special. Sweet tea's forgettable. Prices are steep, Mac's or Midwood's better. Hate when BBQ joints skimp on portions, feels like Subway. Service is top-notch though, dudes behind the counter are friendly, quick, and chatty."

"Hark, good sir! If thou desirest ice cream with a twist,
Thou shalt have it, by my troth. My two small daughters,
Innocent souls, cannot devour a full scoop, I pray thee.
When I did ask, 'May I procure but one scoop,
And a spare bowl, perchance?' The response, alack,
Was naught but a stern refusal. Fie upon't!
I shall journey forth to Cold Stone, yonder,
To fetch the frozen treat myself, ere long."

"Playa Bar, just a small dive. Used to hit it up after work, back when I lived nearby. Native Americans too, they come here often. Best part? They'll package some cold ones for you to take home. Nothing fancy, just a no-frills joint."

"Been here four times, too many times, 'cause I ain't got time to drive all the way to Spring Mtn. But I'm writing this review 'cause my last visit was a real letdown. Service was poor, owner/server didn't even give me a nod or a smile. Just stood there, arms crossed, like he was doin' me a favor. Took him forever to take my order, and when the soup came out, it was like he just threw some noodles and beef in a bowl and called it a day. Didn't even bother to make it look good. And the mini-blinds, man, they were filthy. Made me wonder what else they weren't cleaning. I ordered a large bowl of pho to share with my kid, but it came with like four slices of beef. I asked the owner if that was normal, and he just shrugged it off. Didn't even try to fix it. Not worth my time, and the food's just mediocre anyway."
"Service good, place clean. Food? Subpar. Disappointed. Other cafes better. Pancakes okay, but potatoes and corned beef hash? Dry, flavorless."
"Pricey joint. Food's mediocre. Only thing worth getting's the choco taco. Can get 'em cheaper at a convenience store though."

"I went there, it was good. Two women, they did their job well. Then, I got stuck with an old guy and woman. Fill-ins lasted a week, not two to three like before. My nails ain't growin' faster. They lift after a few days. Guy don't do a good job. Can't make appointments, so I take what I get. If I knew I'd get one of the two ladies, I'd go back. But I keep gettin' the guy, so it ain't worth it no more. Time to find a better salon, one that appreciates us year-round folks, not just the snowbirds."
"Been here a few times, always for oysters. Went last weekend, tried the pan roast. Two thumbs down. Sweet broth, no good. Stick to oysters."

"Two weeks on a diet, and I'd lost some weight. Now on vacation with the girls, didn't want to be a downer. Decided on a big cheat meal, good food and company. Buffet it was, after two hours in line, forty bucks to get in. Disappointment, that's what it was. Sushi, none to be found. Just rice and sadness. King crab legs, that's all they had. Scrambled eggs, pesto potatoes, that's the best they had to offer. Sad, just sad."

"Stereo's the kind of joint you hit up when you're young and don't know any better. Cheap drinks and free entry make for a wild night, but the atmosphere's a bit worn out and the layout's nothing special. They got this tacky night called Shagtag where you get a number sticker and hope someone wants to hook up. It's a sleazy scene, but most folks move on from Stereo once they've had their fill."

"Local diner, first visit a charm. Good grub, top-notch service. Next few visits, not so much. Sketchy food, lousy servers. Why keep going back? Beats me. Haven't been in a bit, sticking with Atlantis Taverna, never disappoints."

"I come here knowing what I want, no time for dilly-dallying. One in ten employees knows their stuff, the rest, not so much. It's frustrating as hell. Customer service? Forget about it. But when I do score what I need, the price is damn right."

"Hotel was a letdown. Service was poor, staff unfriendly and inept. Suite rooms were decent but overdone, sunken living room couch was grimy. Casino was average, not as nice as others. Overpriced for what you get. Pool was crowded, slow service. Writing this review is a bummer."

"Went to Madison with the kids on a recent visit. Don't go there if you're not a fan of clowns and circus stuff. Menu's a joke, 30 pages of nothing special. Had a hot dog, meatloaf, mashed potatoes, cheeseburger, reuben, and some soup. All of us agreed, big disappointment. Kids liked their chicken tenders though, guess I haven't brainwashed them enough yet about clowns being evil. Place might be good for dessert and a quick peek with the kids, but don't expect a great meal."

"Went to this joint in the Chinese Cultural Center. Nice spot, good grub. Piano player added class. Service? Not so much. Waiter didn't introduce himself, barely checked on us. Food came quick though. Good stuff. Shame about the service."

"Festival was a bust. Overhyped, underwhelming experience. More like a glorified craft fair than an art fest. Atmosphere was lackluster too. Friend and I bailed early, hit up the arcade instead. Spent all our cash there. Would've been more fun if I were a decade younger. Parking's a pain, suggest biking or parking far and walking. Some talented folks, but nothing jaw-dropping."

"Hark, good sir! Thou sayest thou art content
With warm brew, priced at seven dollars and a half,
So long as sporting spectacle doth grace thy sight.
Yet, alack! The portion sizes didst stir surprise,
And caused quite a commotion'mongst the crowd.
But, verily, the garb of yonder servers,
Didst remind thee of thy automobile's plight,
In need of oil, to keep it running bright."
"Lucky's, yearly ritual. Gambler's platter, shrimp, salad, spuds - top-notch. Steak? Downhill slide. Disappointment."

"O, why doth everyone delight in Antonio's fare?  Thin crust, aye, 'tis but a woeful snare.  Toppings, they do but drown in oil, a sorry sight.  Freshness of ingredients, a question most dire.  Price, alack, doth rival that of gold, forsooth.  Methinks I do but crave a pie less oily, a slice not soaked in grease, perchance.  Yet, one virtue doth this place possess, a diversity of toppings vast and wide, from tortellini to tortilla chips, blue cheese, steak, and bacon, they do proffer all, with oil aplenty, and a lascivious grin, they doth present it to thee, fair patron."

"Hillside Spot ain't worth your time, pal. Went there with my girl after a trip to Ikea, looking for a quick bite. Ordered the Blue Sky burger and a salad/sandwich combo. Now, the chopped salad was decent, but the grilled veggie sandwich? Disgusting. Driest bread I've ever seen, and the veggies were drenched in oil and grease. And they call that the healthy option? Please. The Blue Sky burger was no better. Couldn't taste anything but the blue cheese. Biggest disappointment in a while. Three and a half stars? Overrated, if you ask me."

"Yogurtland's been my go-to spot for months now, four days a week. Friendly staff, great selection. Decided to mix it up and tried agave. Loved the cake batter yogurt, thought it might be my new fave. Went back the next day, and damn, it was gone. They swap flavors daily, unlike Yogurtland. Impressed by the cashier's tech savvy, 15 different cables for charging. Asked for an iPhone charger, he didn't have one. Are you kidding me? The most popular device in the world and he doesn't have a charger? Pricey too, Yogurtland's 8 cents per ounce cheaper. Adds up quick with a fam of five."

"Went here tonight for dinner. Experience was just above mediocre. Chose the place off Yelp. Cook Indian food at home, but sometimes crave restaurant version. Ordered mixed grill plate for apps and chicken tikka masala and naan for main. Mixed grill had kabobs of chicken, lamb, and beef on a thick bed of sautéed onions. Arrived sizzling hot. People turned heads. Salivating, dug in. Chicken was dry. Seekh kabobs overpowered with spices, mostly red pepper. Quantity? Abysmal. Onions weighed more than meat. Tikkas were standard. Oily, spicy gravy, cubed chicken. Good for students, close to ASU. Won't go back."

"This joint was a bust. I was hoping for some real deal Italian grub, but it didn't deliver. Not even close. I mean, I've had better pasta in New York. And don't even get me started on the pick-up situation. Cold food, 15 minutes late? What a joke. I'll stick to the real stuff, thanks."

They're sliding downhill fast. Dinner comes with cole slaw, upgrade to soup or salad for 2.50 extra. Never heard of cole slaw as a pre-meal. I went with French Onion Soup, better at Mimi's. Too much cheese, pathetic bread, not enough onions.

Prime rib comes with weak horseradish, cut with butter. Never heard of that before. Luckily, I had sour cream with my baked potato and asked for raw horseradish. It wasn't great, but better than the butter.

Barbeque chicken was just okay. Had better at diners. Didn't season the bird well, just threw some barbeque sauce on it. At least it wasn't dry...

Don't think I'll be back. Nope.

"Store had a fair spread, but the help wasn't worth a damn. Walked in, nobody said a word. Not a soul. Just stood there, gossiping like a couple old hens. Made me feel like I shouldn't be there. Like they didn't want my business. Place was dead, middle of shopping season. That tell you something?"
"Brunch at St. Francis, loud world, bloody mary, good grub, service improving, jazz trio, can't hear a thing, weekend confusion, not a jazz club, need relaxation, down the street."
"Food was good. Ate chow mein, calamari, wasabi octopus, roll. Review's shot though. They moved us mid-meal for another group. Ruined dinner, appetite."

"Upon mine visit to fair Vegas, I chanced upon a nail salon,
Whose service, alack, did leave me in dismay.
The staff, in sooth, were friendly and quite dear,
But she who tended to mine feet, did lack the flair.

Her touch was dull, her skills uninspired,
And for the price, I did expect far more.
The samples they proffered, old and stale,
Did naught but add to mine disappointment sore.

In truth, the experience was not the worst,
But neither did it rank among the best.
I do confess, I had hoped for more,
But alas, 'twas not to be, and now I must implore.

A second chance, I fear, I cannot grant,
For this salon, whose name I shall not chant.
My rule of thumb, it seems, must be set aside,
For here, my friends, my pedicure did not reside."

"Burgers were solid, meat's top-notch. But, damn, pricey. Just a burger, nothing else. Sides cost extra. Went on a Saturday, place was dead slow. One girl at the register, line out the door. She's shouting welcome/thanks every time someone comes in or leaves. Kids with us, waited forever. Not the spot for young ones, better options elsewhere."

"Verily, I have graced this establishment with mine own presence on multiple occasions. 'Tis a humble abode, conveniently located near mine place of employment, and the prices of their happy hour do please mine eyes. The house margarita, alas, doth leave much to be desired, being of a meager portion and overwhelmed by an abundance of ice. The happy hour fare, too, doth lack a certain je ne sais quoi, being naught but ordinary victuals.

"The outdoor seating, when the weather doth permit, doth provide a modicum of charm, facing as it doth a spacious parking lot. And, indeed, when the elements are favorable, they do open wide the bar doors, allowing the ambiance to spill forth into the open air.

"In conclusion, this place doth leave me somewhat unmoved. The victuals, alas, doth lack a certain finesse, and the drinks, too, doth fail to impress. Yet, mayhap, in time, they shall improve, and mine opinion shall change."

"Upon mine eyes, this place doth seem most fair,
With lowly walls that make one feel most welcome there.
The music, good; the artwork, quite impressive too,
And huge TVs, that doth make the sporting crowd anew.

But lo, the price of drinks, doth make me pause,
For nineteen silver pieces, two vodka redbulls, what cause!
I could, myself, purchase a bottle of the same,
And thus, I fear, my feet didst stick most strangely to the frame.

In opening week, the place doth seem most foul,
Unclean, unkempt, how strange, doth make me cower.
Yet still, despite these flaws, the place doth hold,
Great potential, but alas, the prices, they do bold.

For they doth attract, a certain sort of crowd,
Scottsdale dbags, most surely, they are loud.
So we, didst leave, after a half hour's stay,
Forsooth, the prices, they didst drive us away."

"Hark! My fellow workers didst speak highly of this place,
And with good cause, for the prices be fair and the portions, plentiful.
But alas, the victuals themselves, didst leave much to be desired.
The chips and salsa, lacked depth of flavor and saltiness,
And a colleague, didst express discontent with his shrimp cocktail,
Declaring it tasted of Louisiana's fiery sauce, most unpleasant.
Yet, the horchata, a sweet and refreshing drink, didst please,
And the service, friendly and attentive, didst make amends."

"Methinks 'twas the most vile Mexican feast I e'er didst taste,
A basic dish of beef enchiladas, yet oh so unpalatable!
Tasted of naught but salt, with a side of enchiladas, rice, and beans,
Freshness lacking, plastic-like, o'ersalted, and foul smelling,
Barely didst I take a few bites, such was my disgust and woe.
Even the salsa, far too salty, with garlic o'erabundant,
Didst make my stomach churn and turn, in utter discontent.
The server, with a kindly heart, didst express his concern,
And swore to tell the kitchen of my bitter disappointment.
But alas, we didst deceive, and vowed to return no more,
For there be better options in the QC, that we didst explore."

"Our meal at this establishment was naught but woe, save for the gentle nature of the server who didst take our order with grace and courtesy. Alas, the victuals that were brought before us didst fall far short of our expectations. The bhindi masala, a dish we hadst eagerly anticipated, didst lack even the barest hint of salt, rendering it insipid and flavorless. The yellow daal, too, didst fail to impress, its taste being somewhat akin to that of dishwater. Only the chicken Tikka masala didst offer any solace, its flavors being passable, albeit not exceedingly so. And, alas, the laccha paratha, a dish we hadst hoped to savor, didst resemble in both appearance and taste nothing so much as a humble butter nan. Our wait, furthermore, didst drag on at an interminable pace, leaving us to ponder the wherefore of such sluggishness. In conclusion, our visit to this restaurant didst prove a disappointment, and we wouldst not recommend it to any soul seeking culinary delight."

"China Poblano's got a swell design, that metal Buddha entrance way's a real knockout. But let's get down to business, the prices are plain silly. Sure, the grub's got some style and flavor, but it ain't worth the cost. Take their "When Pigs Fly" buns, four of 'em for twelve bucks? That's a joke, right? You can get a better deal at a Chinese bakery on Spring Mountain, and that's no lie. They're practically giving it away compared to China Poblano. It's like they're putting on a freak show, overpricing their dim sum. Don't believe me? Check it out for yourself, then hit up a regular Chinese joint and see how much more you can get for your money."

"Nails done here for the big day. Paint job was messy, but I figured a good scrub would fix it. Girl was nice, fun to chat with. Nails looked great, shiny and all that. But the coat didn't last the day, varnish ran out fast. Thinned out too much, I reckon. Pricey for what you get. Do your own nails, save some cash. Won't be back for my nails."

"I swung by for a veggie burger, hankerin' for some onion rings. Their veggie burger comes loaded with sprouts and cucumbers, but I ain't too keen on all that greenery on a burger. So I got it with cheese and left off the extras. It was a bit dry and overcooked, not much different from a frozen veggie burger. If a restaurant's gonna have one on the menu, they should at least try to make it better than the store-bought kind. But hey, they must be doin' somethin' right, 'cause I had to wait a while for my grub, even during off-hours. The onion rings were a bit greasy, and the breading was fallin' off, so the main reason I came was a bust too. Not the best option for us vegetarians, but maybe it'll hit the spot for the meat-eaters."

"Ten years back, I hit Vegas for the first time. The airport dazzled me with its bright lights and slots. Fast forward to now, and I'm back in town. The place could use a refresh, though. They dropped a pretty penny on City Center, but the airport's still stuck in the past. A fresh coat of paint would work wonders. Don't need no SFO-style revamp, just a little TLC."

"Good pizza, but damn expensive. Their pepperoni specialty pizza costs $15.95 for a small 12 inches. Add a topping, and it's around $20 for a personal pizza. They also ask for a tip up front, which feels awkward. Not much service to tip for either. Pizza's dropped off at your table, and you have to get your own napkins, plates, condiments, and red pepper from the bar. You're expected to bus your own table too. Other options like salads and sandwiches are overpriced too. Good food, but you pay a premium for it. Not worth it."
"Smoke-filled poker room, cramped and weak. Slot machines nearby, haze drifts in."

"Went to lunch with the fam today. Haven't been to this joint in a while. Table was sticky, real unpleasant. Looked outside, saw four flies on the window sill. Inside, it was dirty too. White shutters, grimy as hell. Ordered an iced tea, hoping to convince the crew to bounce. Auntie wanted pie though. Tea wasn't brewed, disappointing. Got the potato soup, meatball sliders, and double cream lemon pie. Soup was good, creamy, delicious. Meatballs, just okay. Onions were nice, meatloaf was grainy. Like, MRE grainy. Sent one home. Pie was great though, lemon filling, lemon cream. Crust was flaky, nice. Clean up your act, restaurant. Go back to brewed iced tea. You do well with the classics, meatloaf was just meh. Two stars, hate to give it, but cleanliness and tea, real turn-off."
"Slow. Service friendly, but wasteful. Gas idles, orders messed. Not worth it."

"Tomorrow, I'll reach out to those folks about the busted apple they sold me. They loaded some new software, but still can't access Hotmail, Gmail, YouTube, etc. It's all good if you don't need to log in. The Apple crew says they've never seen anything like it. I'll keep you posted on what the doc says. If they won't play ball, I'll hit up the university president, BBB, and that TV station that helps with this sorta thing. For now, AYOR on anything bigger than furniture or office supplies."

"Methought I ordered chicken lo mein, a lunch most fine,
But what they brought me was a pork dish, oh so divine!
The wait, it did take quite a while, I must confess,
But when 'twas served, alack, 'twas not what I did quest.

The pork, it was chewy, and the chicken, too,
No seasoning couldst I taste, naught but blandness anew.
The lo mein, it was passable, but with an oily trace,
And egg drop soup, devoid of flavor, left me in a daze.

An egg roll, strange and mysterious, its contents unkempt,
I broke it apart, but still, its taste was hard to detect.
Red sweet and sour sauce, with heat that did surprise,
But not so bad, methought, a pleasant compromise.

Twice before, I had dined here, and found the fare
To be but mediocre, alas! And now, I do declare,
This third time, it seems, their cooking skills have fled,
For I shall not return, though 'tis near to my bed.

Alas, I would support local businesses, 'tis true,
But this place, I fear, doth not meet my expectations anew."

"Went out for drinks with the boyfriend, expecting a nice night out. But the joint was packed and the bartenders were too busy chatting up their buddies to give us much attention. Service was slow, real slow."
"Overpriced. Twenty-one bucks for a burger, curds, water, and two cones. Not worth it. Culver's would've been better. Food was meh, custard was decent."

"Lemon-filled donut, powdered sugar coating. My husband bit into it, crunched down on something hard. Glass. A big piece of it. Our go-to spot for donuts, made fresh daily. Usually great, but not today. Swallowed some, I took the rest back to the store. Showed it to the manager, asked him to remove 'em from the shelf. Refunded my cash, but the donuts remained. Buyer beware."

"Lakeside, what's happened to you? You were my go-to yarn shop in Madison, but now you're a shadow of your former self. The people who took over from The Knitting Tree have ruined you. I visited recently and was excited to see what had changed, but what I found was a sad, barren space. The wall of Cascade 220 is gone, the yarn in the coffeeshop room is gone, and what little yarn remains is scattered thinly throughout the shop. It's like they've given up on trying to make it a real yarn store. No one greeted me or offered to help, and when I left, no one seemed to care. It's a real shame."

"Old hotels on the strip, trying to keep up with the young bloods like Aria and Cosmo. Tropicana, tried and failed. Service slow as molasses, like pulling teeth to get a room service that takes forever to arrive, food's not even hot. Asked for towels, took 'em an eternity to arrive, same story at their beach club joint. Friendly folk, but that ain't enough. Not worth the dough, room's mediocre at best. Lots of old timers, just FYI."

"Airport prices, I get it. But ten bucks for a tiny burrito? Not worth it. Felt like a robbery. Had a layover, should've walked around. Sure enough, there's a Mickey D's. Don't waste your cash here if you're starving."
"Big and messy. Chaos, even with a list. Lines everywhere, going nowhere. VIP host, suit still tagged. Douchebag. Get it tailored, idiot."

"Terrible experience at the Lexus dealership. Loved the selection, but the sales associate, Easton McIntosh, was awful. Made me feel belittled and uncomfortable. Unprofessional. Wouldn't work with me even though I had a 50% cash down payment. Looking for a different dealership where they appreciate my business. Anyone know of a better sales associate at this dealership? Thanks."

"Dr. Anjali Iyengar? Green, real green. No bedside manner, no tact. Textbook answers, zero empathy. Treats patients like they're just clients, nothing more. Don't expect personal care or concern from this doc. If you want critical care from an inexperienced dr., she's your gal. But if you want someone who'll treat you like a human being, keep lookin'. She won't give two thoughts about you beyond your visits. Openly admits she doesn't care 'bout patients or their caregivers. Push her a bit, see what she says."

"Gas station bathrooms ain't exactly known for their luxury, but this one takes the cake. Or rather, it don't take nothing, 'cept maybe a few bucks off the price of a fill-up. But hey, you get what you pay for, right? So we stopped in, 'cause why not, it's cheap. And boy, did we regret it. The john was a real dump, like something outta them horror flicks where folks get axed in a crummy gas station. You know, the kinda place you pray before you go, and then sanitize your hands till they're raw afterward. Cigarette butts all over the floor, some dude in the next stall soundin' like he's birthing a baby grizzly. Just nasty. They get two stars 'cause they're cheap, but that's about it. Don't recommend takin' the kiddos here, ya hear me?"

"Love this joint, but not so much these days. Service is crap. Waited 30 minutes for a drink, no one bothered to clear our plates, and the waitress was too busy preening in the mirror. Only gave it two stars 'cause the happy hour drinks are decent. Sushi's mediocre, and the staff thinks they're hot shit."

"GE's too big, too pricey. Seen same grub cheaper at other joints. Don't like the crowds, the airport vibe. Minority, I know. Most folks want more, bigger, pricier. Put up with cruddy parking, long lines. Me? I'm good with the Shakespeare St. GE. Park right outside, no issues with fresh stuff, service."
"Reservations needed, three tries. Looks normal outside, better inside. Crowded, servers bump chairs, plenty space. Overrated, get same food elsewhere. Not worth it."

"Hark! A tale of woe doth come from Gypsy Cafe,
Where dinner was naught but a sorry affair.
A burger from Wendy's didst I consume,
For the meal was so vile, 'twas hard to endure.

The service, though pleasant, was slow as molasses,
With no sense of urgency, nor any haste.
Our party of four didst wait for main courses,
But after 35 minutes, still we had not been asked.

The appetizers, just passable, not too bad,
But salads, o'er-dressed, with watery sauce, they had.
Entrees, a disappointment, save for my companions',
My farfalle pasta, flavorless, a true frustration.
No seasoning, no salt or pepper, a bland disgrace,
Even my fellow diners, in agreement, didst taste.

Alas, the slow service didst mar any delight,
In the meals my friends didst enjoy, but not quite right.
Gypsy Cafe, a letdown, a shame, a sorrow,
A place I shall not revisit, nor tomorrow."

"O, how my heart doth sing with joy at sight of this fair room! 'Tis a true marvel, with lighting that doth rival the sun itself. And what a bar! So grand and spacious, fit for a king. The furniture, too, doth impress, with its fine craftsmanship and elegance. Alas, my friends, for all its beauty, the victuals served here do leave much to be desired. A humble burger, cooked to perfection, doth seem too much to ask, and yet, 'tis lacking. Fie upon it! What a shame, for otherwise, this place were worthy of five stars, easy."
"Hot dog joint. Onion rings, decent. Foot long, meh. Chili dog, subpar. Diet Dr Pepper, too much soda water. Pricey. Not impressed. 3's too generous."

"Taxi ride, strange. Call, ask for pickup. Woman, no guarantee. I, use another. Man calls back, says 15 min. House, five min away. Guy shows, waits outside. I bring bags down. He coughs, spits phlegm. Drop-off, not curbside. Drag bags again. Airport, safe. Fare, fair. Light rail, better."

"Thou hast arrived for thine Prime Ribs, full of hope and anticipation. Alas, thy meal didst not meet thy expectations, for it was undercooked, a fate most woeful. Thou didst return it twain, and still, the chef didst not heed thy request. Thy food didst suck, a truth most vexing. Management didst offer thee some solace, in the form of a discount, yet thou didst crave naught but a savory feast. A pox upon the chef, for his lack of skill doth mar the reputation of this establishment, once so esteemed."

"Dim sum brunch, great. Dinner, not so much. Service, slow. Manager, called over. Waitress, appeared. Orders, given. Green beans, arrived. Noodles, still waiting. Manager, called over again. Waitress, checked with chef. Few more minutes, promised. Dishes, decent. Together, would've been nice."

"Thou, my kin, didst lead us to this place,
For supper, and the victuals, they were fair.
The room, it was devoid of people's race,
When we did dine, the servers, they were rare."

"A paltry sum of eight coins, for a meal most vile and tasteless,
A chicken pita, with naught but fowl within,
And yet, the masses throng, in numbers great,
To this place, where flavor doth not dwell,
A mystery, indeed, that doth my mind perplex.

Akin to McDonalds, in its chain-like stature,
Zoe's Kitchen doth proffer sustenance most wretched,
Yet, folk do claim it locally owned,
In error, I fear, for 'tis a franchise well-known.

http://www.zoeskitchen.com/menu.asp,
A link, which doth reveal their offerings bare,
And thus, my friends, I pray thee, beware."

"I passed by the joint a few times before deciding to give it a shot.  Brought my sis along for the ride.  Decor was top-notch, but that's where the praise ends.  Staff was alright, but seemed in a hurry.  Now, the grub.  Didn't exactly blow my mind.  Got the hangover omelet and it was a bit...puffy.  Reminded me of a fast food breakfast.  Sis had the coney and wasn't impressed.  Said the chili was subpar and the dog wasn't much better.  Didn't finish our meals and bailed.  Maybe their desserts are their strong suit, but the food?  Not so much."

"Good service, helpful guys. Sold old gear for store credit, plus 10%. Thought it was a good deal. Should've taken cash. Went back for a lens, told 10% was already added to credit. Didn't make sense. Disappointed, felt like false advertising."

"First time at the Festival of India in Charlotte. Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

"Five bucks for parking, five to get in. Street festivities, food, and shopping. Henna tats inside, additional five clams. Sloppy work on one finger. Overpaid and not returning. Indian restaurant it is."

"Airport's a joke. Windy location, constant delays. Dirty too. Had to connect here, sprinted to the gate. No signs, had to beg for directions from some airline hack. What a cluster. Unmarked doors, stairs, loading dock, shuttle bus. What a crock."

"A tiny space, full to the brim,
With patrons sweltering, nary a seat within.
A fee to enter, and drinks that doth cost dear,
Yet still they came, for karaoke was the cheer.

Country and rock, the tunes they did play,
Sung by those who came to pass the day.
Cute bartenders, though not so fair,
Did serve with grace, despite the glare.

In comparison to its New York kin,
This place did lack, and thus did sin.
But still, a spot for merriment and cheer,
For those who sought such atmosphere here."

"Verily, the fairest feature of this place,
The Apple store, doth shine with grace.
Yet, alas, the entrance and parking,
A woeful plight, doth cause much vexing.

Too little space, or valets only,
Doth make the access, quite lonely.
A village of shops, doth spread,
But, alack, the drive, doth take,
The summer sun, doth bring,
Little cheer, to make it sing.

Thus, I do ponder, how this place,
In summer's heat, doth find its grace."
"Excalibur show, excellent. Horse looked good. Casino, dirty. Hire someone to clean, please."

"Drive-thru menu's a mess. Prices and items jumbled together, hard to tell what's what. Ended up paying five bucks for a taro boba with whipped cream I didn't want. Attendant didn't give me a chance to decline, just slapped it on there. When I questioned the price, they got attitude with me. Boba was cooked right, but not worth the hassle and rudeness. Adding it to the 'do not return' list."

"Appointment for a drink? Please. Bartenders act like they're doin' me a favor, just standin' around, lookin' bored. Service downstairs is better, but food's bland and slow from the kitchen. And the prices? Ridiculous. Thirty-five, forty bucks for overcooked, oily grub. Arnold says, 'Won't be back.' PS, it smells funny too."

"Hilldale's changed. For the worse. They took the mall outside. In Madison, Wisconsin. What's the point? I liked it when it was small shops. Inside. No worries about the weather. But now? Most are gone. It's a ghost town."
"Pizza, great. Service, terrible. Sunday, 2 pm. Counter girls, unfriendly. Looked drugged. Barely smiled. Didn't explain. First-timers, ignored. Many complaints. Won't return."

"Hark, what news is this? A McDonald's with but two reviews? Fie upon it, let us make it three! 

Verily, I say unto thee, not the best of eateries. Four times have I graced its threshold, and thrice have they botched my order. Oh, the horror! Chicken mcnuggets, they didst promise, yet nary a morsel didst they deliver. Twenty minutes didst I wait, in vain, alas! 

But fear not, dear traveler, for within its walls, the establishment doth boast a spacious interior, neat and tidy. And, by the by, 'tis situated off the beaten path, with ample parking at thy disposal. 

Pray, heed my words, and seek out In-and-Out, but a stone's throw distant. Fare thee well!"
"Pizza? Burned. Taste? Meh. Owner? Cranky. Attitude? Needs adjustin'. Friendly? Not really. New York's better."

"Went to this joint last weekend. Host showed us to our table, grumpy old bastard. Told us where to sit and pointed at the menu, but didn't bother walking us there or handing them over himself. We waited for a server, and when she finally showed up, we ordered two cosmopolitans. Took a sip, looked at each other, and knew we couldn't drink that crap. Awful taste, can't even describe it. Ordered an appetizer, asked for new drinks, and the server said sure thing. Watched her mock us to the bartender, luckily no spit. Had our wine, appetizer came soon after. Food was great, loved the peel 'n eat shrimp. Customer service was shitty, but the food made up for it. Giving it another shot, hoping for a better experience next time."

"Hark! All Cheesecake Factories be the same,
I've seen a few, and this one's no different,
If thou dost enjoy one, thou shalt enjoy this,
In service, naught but mediocrity doth reign,
Long wait at dinner time, we didst gamble,
And drank to pass the time, our spirits to lift,
But when we sat, the service was naught special,
Just what thou'dst expect from such a place,
The food, middling, naught to write home about,
As any other Cheesecake Factory, 'twas the same,
Shall I return? Nay, I think not, my friend."

"Weekend night, 12:30 AM. Out with pals, raisin' hell. "Hey, let's hit Mario's!" They convinced me, so up we went, to the top floor. DJ spinning 90s jams, then suddenly, modern crap. Packed house, short skirts, popped collars, stale beer and cologne in the air. Found a spot to dance, drink, chat. Group of fancy bros laughed and farted our way. Gross. Waitress spilled beer on me, apologized with a shoulder grab. Girl fell taking off her heels. Dudes swarmed, talking watch prices. Not my scene. Mario's is decent for grub and sports, avoid peak hours."

"Fare fit for kings, yet priced for peasants' pockets.  Alas, the service, woeful and wretched, doth leave much to be desired.  A band of ten, in prime of life, didst seek sustenance and strong drink, naught else.  Our waitress, fair maid, didst ignore us, while all around, others didst receive attentive care.  Fie upon this woeful service!  Twain, at most, doth merit this poor showing."

"The room's not bad for the price, but the casino's a bust. Don't count on a fun night of gambling and drinks with the emotionless dealers. They're as friendly as a brick wall. And good luck getting a drink at the bar. The bartenders don't care about you unless you're flashing cash. If you're on a budget, stick to Luxor for your stay, but take your gambling and partying elsewhere."

"Tsk, tsk, good sir! Thou art deceived, methinks,
By this eatery's fare, so plain and weak.
Alack, the wine, a poor vintage, doth lack
The richness that a true connoisseur doth seek.

I prayed for culinary bliss, alas,
But found naught but disappointment, 'twas
A meager portion, a paltry sum,
For which I paid a princely some, ere now.

Ah, cruel fate! The ambiance, fair and bright,
Didst contrast starkly with the victuals' plight.
Alas, the beans, a humble side, didst bring
No solace to my troubled stomach's wring.

In faith, I say, avoid this place, my friend,
Lest thou desirest a meal that doth offend."

"Indian joint. Oily grub. Flavor was alright. Experience? Meh. 
- Used a Yelp coupon. Owner wasn't thrilled. Seemed like we were doing him a favor. 
- Had a private shindig going on. Kids ran wild. Noise galore. Jumped on our tables. Service? Non existent. Didn't give a damn about the trouble. 
- Better options in Vegas. Avoid this dump if you can."
"Food unimpressive. Ate there once. Won't return. Try food court or TGI Fridays."
"Tacos, queso, guac. Flavor? None. Guac, a disappointment. Service, slow and uncaring. Better options for Mex. Won't return."

"Hark! What disappointment doth my heart now bear,
At this dealership where I sought a t-shirt fair.
Many workers there were, in the retail space,
Yet none did ask if we required some grace.
Perhaps my visage doth not bespeak a biker's wife,
But still, a courteous word had been a pleasant life.

A neat t-shirt for my man I didst find,
And if parts for a hog we needed, they were kind.
But alas! A haughty demeanor from the salesman,
Doth leave a sour taste, and doth detract from their plan.
To Phoenix' dealer shall I return, anon,
For other wares, yet with a wary heart, alone.

Oh! In the restroom, faucets most fine didst gleam,
A curious sight, and worthy of note, it seemed."

"Terrible experience from the start. Rushed through ordering, waited over 20 minutes for the food. Took it back to my office, and it was a disaster. Smelled bad, tasted worse. Not what I expected. Had Mongolian Beef and Clear Soup. Never had such poorly prepared Asian food. Greasy, over-spiced, tough beef. Undercooked rice. Mediocre soup. Overpriced for $13. Disappointed and still hungry."

"Underwhelming experience with too much repetition."

"Food's alright, service is slow. Not worth the bother."

"Lunchtime. Service slow. Food passable. Sashimi Benito box. Miso dressing, watery and dull. Forgot my seaweed salad. Told the waitress. No apology, no offer to fix. Just a smile when she took it off the bill. Like she did me a favor."

"I ain't one to write on Yelp much, but I gotta give my two cents on this joint. Reviews are all over the place, so I reckon I'll be the deciding vote. Here's the deal - either this place is hit or miss depending on when you visit, or folks in Madison just don't know good BBQ. Now, I'm from NYC, so I'm spoiled when it comes to grub. But I love BBQ, so my standards ain't too high. This place didn't cut it. Had the full rack of ribs with mac and cheese, succotash. Sides were meh, nothing special. Ribs were overcooked, dried out, and plain terrible on their own. Sure, slap some BBQ sauce on 'em and they're edible, but that's like sayin' cardboard's good eatin' too. Not worth the price, especially by Madison standards. Stay away."

"Dairy Queen, worst service. Always dirty, no manager. Spills stay on floor, not cleaned. Girl brings food, kid runs in front. Drinks spilled, not replaced. Go back, ask for it. Forget daughter's smoothie."

"Alas, poor grub, fit for naught but swine,
Yet priced as if 'twere dainties most divine.
And to accompany this sorry feast,
A draught, so weak it doth the senses cheat.
The only grace, a kindly server's art,
Doth lift this wretched tavern to two stars, a part."
"Service? Non-existent. Seated six inches from another table, despite being told otherwise. Waited forever for a server who never came. Got up and left. Disappointed."

"A paltry spread, my friend, forsooth,
Fifteen silver pieces per head, they didst proffer.
Meat and taters, greens and more,
But naught else doth grace the board, I do declare.
A long queue, a winding line,
To gain entrance, ye must be inclined.
And once within, 'tis true,
The victuals, plain, and naught anew.
So, prithee, take my counsel,
And choose a humble burger, 'twill serve thee well."

"The joint looked swell, but the service? Forget it. They charged me to try on their crummy dresses, then gave me grief for bringing my whole crew. Rude, man. Real rude. And the dresses? Most were straight-up tacky. But I bit the bullet and bought one anyway. Big mistake. The corset was a nightmare for my bridesmaid to lace up, uncomfortable as hell, and left me with some serious bruises that lasted three months. That's right, folks - this place ruined my wedding day. Don't waste your time or money. Oh, and the dress they made me? Didn't even look like the one I tried on. What a joke."

"We hit the casino outside Montreal, me and the boys. I'm not big on gambling, but my buddy likes to throw around some cash. I stick to blackjack, couple drinks on the house. Nice surprise, no smoking on the floor. Don't mind it myself, but it's a little strange for a casino. Drinks only in the bar area, clocks and windows too. Not like Vegas, that's for sure. Still, it's a good spot. Layout's clean, easy to navigate."
"Price didn't match the menu's mediocrity. Not a single dish worth the bill. Better options in Vegas."

"Tucked away in a side commercial building, this joint's got a home garage vibe, sellin' Micargi Walmart bikes. Found 'em on Craigslist, decided to swing by last week after checkin' out other bike shops. If you're lookin' for a cheap Walmart bike from a makeshift setup, this might be your spot. They got a small worktable cluttered with tools, no computer, looks kinda disorganized. No fancy signage either, just a sticker on the window. Their Craigslist ad said to check 'em out on Yelp, so I did."

"Range looks good, prices fair. Friendly sales folk too. But the check-in crew? Not so much. Told us one lane open, waited, then saw two open lanes next to us. Asked if we could split up and use 'em, but staff said no, they were taken. Seemed pissed when I pointed out they weren't. Like they wanted us to wait. Four of eight lanes sat empty while we were there. Don't take this crap lying down. Press 'em on lanes, don't waste your time."

"This joint keeps suckering me in with its flashy decor, but the grub don't live up to the hype. Twice now, I've stopped by for lunch, and both times my burger's been overcooked. The patty's no better than what they serve at Five Guys down the street. Don't get me wrong, their toppings are top-notch, but they can't make up for the subpar meat. Not worth the dough, if you ask me. Stick with Five Guys."

"Boo! Horrible joint. Loud, overpriced drinks, bad tunes. How folks tolerate it, I don't know. Acrobats were alright, go-go dancers were amusing. Clientele? Odd bunch. Older, socially awkward. No idea why anyone'd wanna replicate this dump's name. Falls short, if you ask me. One star for an Elton John pic on the wall. Completed our running joke for the night."

"Not a fan of overpriced tech, but hubby insisted on Best Buy. Now I'm stuck in Geek Squad line, two employees helping seven customers while three others stand around, doing nothing. Great service. Next time, Dell Direct it is."

"Came 'cause of the rave reviews, but wouldn't go outta my way. Prices ain't so hot, got better deals at Sunflower or Fresh 'n Easy. Geri's got some East Coast snacks too, like Tastykake 'n Wise. Only thing my ma'd go for is pork roll. But livin' at Sandhill, got plenty options, can compare prices 'n all that. Good to have another choice besides overpriced VONS 'n busy Wal-Mart."
"Didn't care for much. Overpriced grub at the rest home. Salad bar was alright, I reckon. That's why they got an extra star."

"Went this mornin', decided on the buffet. Waiter didn't give us a menu, pushin' the buffet hard. It was a letdown, biscuits and gravy the only bright spot. Took 'em a good 10 minutes to notice us waitin' to be seated. Table and chair still dirty when we sat down. Not exactly my best restaurant experience."

"Slow service. Ordered a nonfat chai latte with a shot of espresso, not rocket science. Bitter taste due to poor straining, gritty texture. Decor and patio were nice, though. Didn't try the food, but it looked decent."

"A band of six we were, that dined at n9ne,
On a Sunday eve, at nine o'clock, 'twas seen.
The victuals were fair, not wondrous, I must say,
And the cost, oh dear! It did our purses sway.
The ambiance, too, did leave much to be desired,
In truth, not worth the steep and lofty price required.
There be many other places, far more grand,
With fare and atmosphere, beyond compare, at hand."

"Classic joint, grub's top-notch. Service? Piss poor. Two stars, max. Service is key, ya hear me? Manager's a jerk, won't accommodate a party of 30. Told us to come at 5:30 or 9, said we'd take up too much space. Like, what's the point of having a restaurant if you can't serve customers? Never been talked to like that. Won't be back. Plenty of other steakhouses in Vegas, no need to deal with this dump."
"Vegan menu, good. Service, not so much. Enchiladas, chicken strips in tortillas, no salad. Hubby, vegetarian, special order, two plates, one chicken, one vegan. Not impressed."

"Methinks 'twas strange, this eatery so cramped,
My table in the path of servers, hemmed in,
A freeway of patrons, constant din and fray,
The service slow, the fare, a bit away.

Yet, kind they were, to mine own brood,
Their patience great, with children so rude,
A pleasant sight, in truth, to behold,
Their genuine ways, did my heart enfold.

But, alack, the food, my chief desire,
Didst suffer, beneath a mountain of fire,
Cheese, oh cheese, how thou dost delight,
Yet, when thy bounty doth block my sight,
'Tis too much, methinks, a veritable plight.

After mining through, my noodles so fine,
My meal, not bad, yet, room for design.
An interesting place, yet, needs refinement,
To draw me back, with haste and intent."
